content:
たんよう〔単葉〕
〈形〉Unifoliate

content.content: 単葉飛行機
a monoplane

content:
だんらく〔段落〕
〈名〉The end (of a paragraph or a chapter); a stage (in some process)

content.content: 文章に段落をつける
to write in paragraphs
これで一段落ついた
We have reached the end of the chapter―(より)―The matter has reached a stage―The matter is settled for the time being.

content:
たんらん〔貧婪〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ごうよく〔強欲〕

content:
だんらん〔団欒〕
〈名〉A social circle

content.content: 一家団欒
a domestic circle―a family fireside
楽しき一家団欒にその日の苦労を忘れる
A pleasant family fireside makes one forget day's cares.
彼は一家団欒のうちにあり
He is in the bosom of his family.

content:
たんり〔単利〕
〈名〉Simple interest

content.content: 単利で計算する
to calculate at simple interest

content:
たんりゃく〔胆略〕
〈名〉Courage and resourcefulness

content.content: 胆略の有る人だ
He is a man of courage and resources.

content:
たんりょ〔短慮〕
〈名〉
1. (=短見) short-sightedness:(=なる) short-sighted
2. (=短気) short temper; quick temper; hot temper; ill temper:(=なる) short-tempered; quick-tempered; hot-tempered; ill-tempered

content.content: 短慮功を成さず
A hot-tempered man is liable to failure.
小人短慮
“A little pot is soon hot.”
あれは短慮性急の男だ
He is of a passionate temper―of a fiery temper.
短慮一徹の人だ
He is hot-tempered and stubborn.

content:
たんりょく〔胆力〕
〈名〉Pluck; courage; spirit; nerves; grit; endurance; the powers of manhood

content.content: 彼は胆力が有る
He is courageous―He has grit and endurance.
胆力が無い
He is wanting in courage―wanting in endurance.
胆力を練る、胆力を鍛える
to cultivate the powers of manhood―train the powers of manhood
胆力を試してやった
I put his endurance to the test―put his courage to the test.
胆力が坐っている
He has steady nerves―iron nerves.

だんりょく〔弾力〕
〈名〉Elasticity:(=ある) elastic

content:
たんれい〔端麗〕
〈形〉Elegant; graceful

content.content: 容姿端麗
She has a graceful figure.

content:
たんれつ〔単列〕
〈名〉A single line; a single row

content.content: 単列縦陣
a single column―(艦隊なら)―a line ahead

content:
たんれん〔鍛錬〕
〈名〉
1. (=金属の鍛錬) temper; forging:(=する) to temper, forge (iron)
2. (=詩文の鍛錬) polish:(=する) to polish, file, work (a poem, etc.)

content.content: 文を鍛錬する
to polish one's style
詩歌を鍛錬する
to polish a poem―file a poem―work a poem―elaborate a poem to perfection

content: 3. (=身心の鍛錬) discipline; drill; training; practice:(=する) to discipline, school (the mind); to train (one's body or mind); to practise, drill (a student in English); to harden (one to fatigue); to inure (one to hardships)

content.content: 精神を鍛錬する
to discipline one's mind―school one's mind
(艱難や疲労に堪えるように)身体を鍛錬する
to harden one's body (to fatigue)―inure oneself to hardships
身心を鍛錬する
to train one's body and mind
意志を鍛錬する
to educate the will

content:
だんろ〔暖炉〕
〈名〉A stove

content.content: 暖炉を焚く(焚きつける)
to light the stove
この温かいのに暖炉を焚いているのかね
You have the fire up in this warm weather?

content:
だんろん〔談論〕
〈名〉A discourse; a discussion:(=する) to discourse on (politics); to discuss (the times, etc.)

content.content: 談論風発
He has a good flow of ideas.

content:
だんわ〔談話〕
〈名〉Talk; conversation:(=の) conversational; colloquial:(=する) to talk, converse, carry on conversation (with a person)

content.content: 人と談話を始める
to enter into conversation with one
西洋人は食卓上の談話を好む
Foreigners like to talk at table.
食卓談話
table-talk
彼は談話の才がある
He has conversational powers.
授業中談話はいかん
No talking in class!

だんわたい〔談話体〕
〈名〉A conversational style; a colloquial style

content:
ち〔血〕
〈名〉Blood

content.content: 血が通う
Blood flows in the veins.
まだ血が通っている(木石に非ず)
I am made of flesh and blood.
血の通っている人間には堪えられぬ
No flesh and blood can stand it―It is more than flesh and blood can bear.
血が廻る
Blood circulates.
血の廻りの悪い奴だ
He is dull of comprehension―dull-witted.
血が出る
to run blood―bleed
傷から血が出る
A wound bleeds.
多量に血が出る
to bleed copiously
鼻血が出る
One's nose bleeds―One bleeds at the nose.
血の出るような金だ
It is the price of my life-blood.
血を出す
to draw blood
血を取る(刺絡する)
to let blood―bleed a person
血がほとばしる
Blood spouts.
切口から血がほとばしる
Blood spouts from a wound―The wound spouts blood.
血を止める
to stop bleeding―staunch a wound
血を吐く
to vomit blood―spit blood―cough blood
血を吐く思いをして別れた
I separated from her with a bleeding heart.
血にまみれる
to be smeared with blood―be besmeared with blood
血にまみれた死骸
a gory corpse
血だらけ
He is covered with blood.
血だけらの刀
a bloody sword
血に染まる
to be dyed with blood
血に染まった着物
clothes dyed with blood
着物に血がついていた
His clothes were stained with blood―blood-stained.
血を流す
to shed blood―spill blood―bleed
この事では血を流した
Blood was shed over the matter―There was bloodshed over the matter.
血流れて河を成す
The country ran with blood.
肉飛び血流るる光景
a scene of carnage
血の雨が降るようなことが生ずる
It will rain blood―There will be bloodshed.
血の雨を降らす
to shed blood―enact a scene of bloodshed
飼ってある虎が初めて血の味を覚える
A tame tiger tastes blood for the first time.
(刀が)血を見る
to taste blood
この刀は血を見たことがあるか
Has this blade tasted blood?
血を見たことの無い新身だ
It is a virgin blade that never tasted blood.
村正は血を見なけりゃ鞘に納まらぬ
A Muramasa blade, when drawn, will not return into its sheath unless it tastes blood―till it tastes blood.
この事件は血を見なけりゃ治まらぬ
The matter can not be settled without bloodshed.
血を見ずに治まるなら結構だ
It is well if it can be settled without bloodshed.
血の池、血の海
a pool of blood
血の海に倒れていた
He lay wallowing in a pool of blood.
血が沸く
My blood boils.
彼の言うことを聞くと血が沸く
His words make my blood boil.
血の沸くような冒険談
thrilling tales of adventures
これを思えば血沸き肉踊る
My blood tingles at the thought.
血を沸かす
to make one's blood boil―stir one's blood
冒険談を聞くと英国人は血を沸かす
Tales of adventures stir the blood of Englishmen.
血の多い人
(多血性なら)a man of full habit―a full-blooded man―a plethoric man―(血気の意味なら)―a hot-blooded man―a hot-headed man―a hot head
血も涙もある人
an impulsive man
血も涙も無い人
a cold-blooded man―a man of phlegmatic temperament
血の涙を流す
to shed ［cry, weep］ bitter tears
彼の為に血の涙を流す
My heart bleeds for him.
気違いなどが血を引く
Madness runs in the blood.
誰の血を引いている(誰の子孫なり)
to be descended from―trace one's descent to―some ancestor
島人は日本人の血を引いている
The islanders are descended from Japanese―of Japanese descent―of Japanese extraction―of Japanese lineage―of Japanese blood.
同じ血を引いている
to be of the same blood―consanguineous
血を分けた仲だ
We are consanguineous―of the same blood―related by blood―the same flesh and blood―He is my own flesh and blood.
血を分けた仲は他人とは違う、血を分けた仲に限る、血は血だけ
“Blood is thicker than water.”
彼女は武士の血を享けている
She has samurai's blood in her veins―A samurai's blood flows in her veins.
血で血をあらう
to cause a strife among the same flesh and blood―quarrel with one's own flesh and blood
二人は血をすすって兄弟の誓いを立てた
They drank each other's blood, and became sworn brothers.
肉を喰い血をすすってもなお飽き足らぬ奴だ
I could eat him alive.
血に渇する
to thirst for blood―to be bloodthirsty
女は驚いて血の道を起こした
She was ill of fright.
産婦が血を上げる
A woman in childbed falls into puerperal fever.
血塗れ騒ぎ
a scene of bloodshed―a sanguinary affair
刀に血を塗る
to imbrue one's swords in blood
血煙
a spray of blood
血走った目
bloodshot eyes

content:
ち〔治〕
〈名〉Peace

content.content: 治を図る
to seek for peace―seek for things that make for peace
鋭意治を図る
to strive for peace
治に在りて乱を忘れず
Forget not war in time of peace―Be armed in peace―Always be prepared for war.

content:
ち〔地〕
〈名〉
1. (=天地の地)the earth

content.content: 道義地を払う
Morality has vanished off the face of the earth.
ある国民の如きは地上に跡を留めず
Some nations have disappeared ［vanished, been wiped］ off the face of the earth.
地上に影を絶つ
to wipe a nation off the face of the earth
天低し地狭し
The heavens are not high enough, the earth is not wide enough (for the Japanese student).
天に二日無く地に二君無し
The heavens can not support two suns, nor the earth two masters.
仰いで天に訴え俯して地に叫ぶ
to cry to Heaven and earth for vengeance

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 仰いで天に愧じず俯して地に愧じず
I have done right in the sight of God and man―I am justified before God and man.
天知る、地知る、我が身知る
God knows, and so does my conscience.
天にも地にも一人の君
You are everything to me―all in all to me―all the world to me.

content: 2. (=踏む地)the ground; the soil; land

content.content: 地を踏む
to tread on the ground―set foot on the soil―set foot on land
船酔いは地を踏むとたちまち治る
When you are seasick, you feel well as soon as you set foot on land.
僕は外国の地を踏んだことが無い
I never set foot on foreign soil.
初めて日本の地を踏んだ英国人は Adams
Adams was the first Englishman that ever set foot on Japan's soil.
お前達にはここの地だに踏ませるのはもったいない
It is not for you to set foot on this soil.

content: 3. (=耕す地)the soil; land

content.content: 地を耕す
to till the soil―cultivate land
地肥えて耕作に適す
The soil is fertile and fit for cultivation.
地痩せて耕作に適せず
The soil is sterile and unfit for cultivation.

content: 4. (=落ちる地)the ground; the earth

content.content: 地に落ちる
to fall to the ground―fall to earth
信用は地に墜ちた
His credit is gone.
名声地に墜つ
His reputation is gone―His reputation is blasted―He has lost his reputation.
ドイツの威信地に墜つ
Germany's prestige is gone―Germany has lost her prestige―Prestige has departed from Germany.

content: 5. (=余地の地)room; space

content.content: 立錐の地無し
There is no standing room―The hall is closely packed―filled to overflowing―crowded to suffocation.

content: 6. (=位地の地)position; ground

content.content: 主客地を換える
The positions are reversed―The tables are turned.
有利の地
an advantageous position―vantage-ground―a coign of vantage
有利の地を占める
to occupy an advantageous position―hold vantage-ground
地の利
the advantage of position―the strength of position―a geographical advantage―a strategic advantage
地の利は人の和に如かず
No strength of position can prevail over the strength of union.

content: 7. (=何地の地)place; ground; country

content.content: 御地
your place
当地
this place
眺望絶佳の地
a place noted for its superb views
名所旧跡地
classic ground
産地
the place of production
タバコの産地
a tobacco-country

content:
8. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 繁昌の地に草生えず
“The grass grows not under busy feet.”
一頭地を抜く
to tower above one's contemporaries
一敗地に塗{まみ}る
to suffer a crushing defect―be humbled in the dust

content:
ち〔智〕
〈名〉Knowledge; wisdom:(情に対し)intellect:(智者の智)genius:(時としては)ability

content.content: 智あり
He is wise.
智余りて勇足らず
He is more wise than brave.
勇あれども智無し
He is more brave than wise.
智勇を兼備する
to combine wisdom with valour―unite ability with prowess
智を磨く
to cultivate wisdom―improve one's mind
智を磨き徳を積む
to cultivate wisdom and virtue―attain intellectual and moral excellence―seek truth and do good
智情意
intellect, emotion, and will
彼は智の人だ
He is an intellectual.
智の人は崇拝せられ情の人は服従せらる
Intellectuals are admired; emotionals are followed.
男は智、女は情
Man has a head to think; women has a heart to feel.
智仁勇
wisdom, virtue, and valour
智徳
wisdom and virtue―knowledge and virtue
智ある者は往々徳を欠く
Men of genius are often found wanting in virtue.
智は権なり
Knowledge is power.

content:
ち〔乳〕
〈名〉A loop

content.content: 乳に旗竿を通す
(=羽織や旗などの乳)to pass a flagstaff through the loops

ちあい〔血合〕
〈名〉The black meat (of some fish)

content:
ちあん〔治安〕
〈名〉The (public) peace; public order

content.content: 治安を妨害する
to break the peace―disturb the public peace―(英国にては)―break the King's peace
治安を妨害せぬ
to keep the peace
治安を保持する
to preserve the public peace―maintain public order

content:
ちあんぼうがい〔治安妨害〕
〈名〉Breach of the peace; the disturbance of the public peace; riot; sedition

content.content: 治安妨害者
a breaker of the peace―a rioter
治安妨害的
seditious (speech, writings, etc.)

content:
ちい〔地位〕
〈名〉
1. (=職務上の地位)a position; a post; a place; a situation; a berth

content.content: 地位を得る
to secure a position―obtain a place―get a situation―get a berth
君の腕前ならどんな地位でも得られる
Your talents will secure you any position you like.
この地位の希望者がさくさんある
Many people wish to secure the position.
僕もこの地位を望んでいる
I am desirous to secure the position.
良い地位を周旋しよう
I will procure you a good position―get you a good berth.
彼は適当な地位を求めている
He is looking out for a suitable position.
英語教員の地位を望んでいる
He wants a position as teacher of English.
彼は良い地位を占めている
He holds a good position―He is well placed.
顧問官の地位を占めている
He holds the place of adviser (to the president)
彼は現在の地位に甘んじている
He is contented with his present position.
人が地位に適している
The man is fit for the post―suited to the post.
地位が人に適している
The place suits the man―The place is suited to the man.
地位を失う(免職になる)
to lose one's place
彼は職務怠慢のために地位を失った
He lost his place through neglect of duty―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Neglect of duty lost him his place―cost him his place.
地位を抛棄する
to throw up one's position―fling up one's situation
地位があく
A post falls vacant.
地位があいている
The post is vacant.
地位をあける
to vacate a post
適任者の無いために地位があけてある
The post is left vacant for want of a fit person.
地位がふさがる
A vacancy is filled.
地位がふさがっている
The post is occupied.
安全な地位
a secure position
今日明日にも危ない地位
a precarious position
僕の自由になる地位
a position in my gift

content: 2. (=社会の地位)(one's social) position, standing, station, status, state, rank

content.content: 地位有る(身分の有る)人
a man of standing―a man of good social standing
彼は地位相当の威厳を保っている
He maintains a dignity due to his social status.
地位相当の生活をしている
He lives in a style befitting his state.
地位に相応な礼をもって彼を遇した
We did him the honour due to his rank―did him due honour.
彼は地位に恥じてそんなことはできまい
It would be beneath his rank to do such a thing.
女の地位を高める
to raise the status of woman
日本の女は地位が高まった
Woman's position has been raised in Japan.
地位を保つ
to keep one's ground―keep one's footing

ちいき〔地域〕
〈名〉A region; a tract (of country)

content:
ちいさい〔小さい〕
〈形〉
1. Small (mind); little (child); tiny (cup); petty (farmer); paltry (sum); puny (baby); diminutive (size); minute (particles); wee (drop, etc.)

content.content: この外套は小さい
This overcoat is too small for me.
この靴は少し小さい
These shoes are a little too small for me.
小さいのが三人あります
We have three little ones.
一番小さいの
the youngest one
そのころはお前はまだ小さかった
Then you were a little child―a tiny mite.
日本人や支那人は小さい茶碗で茶を飲む
The Japanese and Chinese drink tea from diminutive cups.
彼は人間が小さい
He is a man of small calibre.
心が小さい
He has a small mind―He is small-minded.
(大きなものが)小さくなる
to shring-dwindle
(大きなものを)小さくする
to lessen―reduce―contract―condense

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: あの人は小さい時から知っている
I have known him from a child.
子どもが大きくなって着物が皆小さくなる
The boy outgrows his clothes.
彼は隅っこに小さくなっていた
He was crouching in a corner―crouched in a corner.
次郎さんは今日は失錯して小さくなっている
Jiro San has disgraced himself and dare not show his face.
君は人の前で小さくなっていることはない
You need not humble yourself before people.
彼らは娑婆{しゃば}をふさぐ権利がないように小さくなって歩いている
They slink about―sneak about―as if they had no right to a place in the world.
二人は小さい声で話しをしておった
They were talking in a low voice―in whispers.
女は気が小さい
Women are pusillanimous―timid―faint-hearted.

content:
ちいさな〔小さな〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: ちいさい〔小さい〕

content:
ちえ〔智慧〕
〈名〉
1. Wisdom; wit; sense; intelligence; prudence; sagacity

content.content: 智慧が有る
to be wise―witty―sensible―intelligent―prudent―sagacious
彼はその理を解するだけの智慧が無い
He has not the wit to see that―not wit enough to understand that.
一方を棄てるだけの智慧が無いから両方を失う
He has not wit enough to give one up, and loses both.
君はもう少し智慧が有ると思った
I gave you credit for more sense.
君にそんな智慧があるのか(有ろうとは思わなかった)
I did not give you credit for such sense.
智慧がつく
to grow wiser―grow in wisdom―cut one'wisdom-teech―(子どもなら)―grow in intelligence
子どもは日増しに智慧がつく
The child daily grows in intelligence.
智慧に負ける、智慧に使われる
to be deceived by one's own sagacity―One's sagacity overreaches itself
深い智慧
deep wisdom―profound wisdom
浅い智慧
shallow wit
彼は智慧が浅い
He is shallow-witted―shallow-brained.
腹に有りながら口に出せない智慧
inarticulate wisdom
世渡りの智慧
worldly wisdom―prudence
下衆の後智慧
“A fool's wit is after-wit”―“Fools are wise after the event.”
動物の智慧
animal intelligence―animal sagacity
猿智慧
shallow cunning
悪智慧
cunning―craft―guile―wile

content: 2. (=出す智慧、絞る智慧、振るう智慧、めぐらす智慧)wits; brains; resources; devices; ingenuity

content.content: 智慧を磨く
to sharpen one's wits
智慧を出す、智慧を振るう、智慧をめぐらす
to set one's wits to work―draw on one's resources
智慧を振るって金策の方法を講じた
I set my wits to work to device some means of raising money.
智慧を絞る
to beat one's brains―cudgel one's brains―rack one's brains―ransack one's brains―fillip one's wits―tax one's ingenuity
いくら智慧を絞っても出ない
I cudgel my brains in vain.
無い智慧を絞る
I ransack what little brains I have.
智慧が尽きた(途方に暮れた)

I have come to the end of my resources―come to the end of the tether―come to my wits' end―I am at the end of my resources―at the end of the tether―at my wits' end―reduced to my wits' end―driven to my wits' end.
智慧は小出しにせよ
Husband your resources!
智慧を競べる
to measure one's wits with another's―play at a game of skill
智慧比べ
a game of skill
智慧者
a man of resources―a resourceful man

content: 3. (=貸す智慧、借りる智慧)advice; counsel

content.content: 智慧を貸す
to give counsel
智慧を借りる
to profit by counsel
先生のところへ智慧を借りに行った
I went to my teacher for advice.
智慧を借りる人が無くて困る(相談相手が無くて困る)
I am thrown upon my own resources―left to my own devices.
彼は智慧が尽きると借りに来る
When he is at the end of his resources, he comes to me for advice.
智慧を貸せ
I want your advice.
智慧を貸そう
I will give you a piece of advice―give you a hint―give you a tip―(普通は)―I'll tell you what.

content: 4. (=つける智慧、入れる智慧)a suggestion; a hint; an inspiration; an idea; a tip a cue

content.content: 人に智慧をつける
to suggest an idea to one―put an idea into one's head―give one a hint―give one a tip―put one up to something―prompt one to do something―inspire one with an idea
誰が子どもに質を置くような智慧をつけたのか
Who suggested the idea of pawning to the boy?―put the idea of pawning into his head?―put him up to such a thing as pawning?
誰か智慧をつけたに違いない
Some one must have suggested the idea to him―put the idea into his head―given him a hint―given him a tip.
誰かに智慧をつけられたに違いない
He must have been put up to it by some one―been prompted by some one―been inspired by some one―taken the cue from some one.

content:
5. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 三人寄れば文殊の智慧
“Two heads are better than one”―“There is safety in the number of counsellors.”
これはあの男の智慧でない、誰か尻押があるに違いない
He can not have done it of his own head. He must have some one at his back.
無い智慧は出ぬ
“The stream can not rise above its fountain-head.”
大男総身に智慧がまわりかね
“Big and empty”―“Big head, little wit.”
総身に智慧のまわりかねるような大男だ
He is a big hulking fellow.

content:
ちえき〔地域〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ちいき〔地域〕

ちえきけん〔地役権〕
〈名〉［法律］Easement; servitude

content:
ちえくらべ〔智慧比べ〕
〈名〉A game of skill

content.content: 智慧比べをする
to play at a game of skill―measure one's wits with another's
ドイツは列国と智慧比べだ
Germany was playing a diplomatic game―at a game of diplomacy―with the Powers.

content:
ちえしゃ〔智慧者〕
〈名〉A resourceful man; a man of resources; a man of ideas

content.content: 彼はなかなか智慧者だ
He is fertile in resources―full of resource.

ちえのわ〔智慧の輪〕
〈名〉The puzzle-ring; the trifle-ring; gemel-ring

content:
ちえぶくろ〔智慧嚢〕
〈名〉(Some one's) brain, oracle

content.content: 彼は当時の内閣の智慧嚢と評された
He was spoken of as the “brain” of the then Cabinet.

ちえん〔遅延〕
〈名〉Delay; procrastination:(=する) to procrastinate, delay, put off (what ought to be done)

content:
ちか〔近〕
〈副〉Nearly

content.content: 百人近く集まった
Nearly a hundred people came together.

content:
ちか〔地下〕
〈名〉The Hades; the grave; the bowels of the earth

content.content: 地下に瞑す
to rest in peace
乞う地下に瞑せよ
May he rest in peace!―Peace be to his soul!
地下に瞑せず、地下に哭く
to turn in one's grave
沙翁{しゃおう=シェークスピア}をして地下に哭{な}かしむる勿{なか}れ
Do not make Shakespeare turn in his grave!
金銀は地下より掘る
Gold and silver are dug out of the bowels of the earth.

content: 〈形〉Underground; subterranean

content.content: ロンドンには地下生活をする者がある
Some people live underground in London.
地下室
an underground room―a basement―a cellar
地下線
an underground cable
地下戦
subterranean fighting―underground operations
地下鉄道
an underground railway

content:
ちか〔地価〕
〈名〉The value of land:(法定なら)the assessed value of land

content.content: 地価が騰貴した
Land has risen in value.
地価修正
the reassessment of land

content:
ちかい〔近い〕
〈形〉Near, nigh (relation); close (connection); short (road):(副詞に用いれば)nearly:(前置詞に訳せば)to be near (a place); to be near upon, nigh upon, close upon (the hour); to be akin to (something):(動詞に訳せば)to near (completion); to approach (some state); to approximate (some stage); to border on, verge on (something); to amount almost to (something); to be getting on for (the hour)

content.content: 近いところ
a place near here―a place in the neighbourhood―a place in the vicinity
近い火事
a fire in the neighbourhood
近い道
a shorter road―a short cut
この道の方が近い
This road is shorter―the shorter of the two.
両者は近い関係がある
There is a near relation―a close connection―between the two.
近い親類
a near relation―a near kinsman
彼とは近い親類だ
I am nearly related to him.
遠い親類より近い他人
A near neighbour is better than a far relation―(の意味を表わす言葉は)―a “good Samaritan.”
近き将来において一大事件起こらんとす
A great event is about to happen in the near future―W are on the eve of a great event.
近き将来において改革の必要を見るべし
A reform may become necessary in the near future―The day is not far distant when a reform will be necessary.
学校はここからじき近い
The school is quite near here―only a little way from here.
僕の家は学校へ近い
I live near the school.［注意］この語は元と形容詞なるが“near to the school”の“to”を略して前置詞に働く、しかして比較級、最上級には“to”の再現を見る、例えば
僕の家の方が学校へ近い
I live nearer to the school.
誰の家が学校へ一番近いか
Who lives nearest to the school?
世の終りは近し
The end of the world is near.
試験は近い
The examination is close at hand.
学期は終りに近い
The term is near its close―The term draws to a close.
時は十二時に近い(なんなんとす)
It is nigh upon twelve―It is getting on for twelve.
年は四十に近い(なんなんとす)
He is near upon forty―close upon forty―getting on for forty.
猿は人間に近い
The ape is closely allied to man.
土人の人情風俗は日本人に近い
In manners and customs, the natives are closely related to the Japanese.
憐愍は恋愛に近し
Pity is akin to love.
工事は竣工に近い
The works are near completion―nearing completion.
完全に近い
to approach perfection―approximate perfection
彼の芸は完全に近い
His art approaches perfection―His art is nearly perfect.
彼の助かったのは奇蹟に近い
His escape borders on the miraculous.
彼は詐欺に近い手段を用いる
He resorts to means bordering on fraud.
彼らの熱心は発狂に近い
Their zeal verges on madness.
彼の歎願は脅迫に近い
His request amounts almost to a threat.
遠くで近きは男女の仲
“Man is fire, and woman is tow.”

content:
ちかい〔誓い〕
〈名〉A vow; an oath; a pledge; a solemn promise; a word of honour

content.content: 誓いを立てる
to make a vow―take an oath
彼は誓いを立てて酒を絶った
He has made a vow to abstain from wine―He is under a vow of abstinence.
禁酒の誓いを立てる
to sign the pledge―take the pledge
仇討の誓いを立てた
I have made a vow to avenge my father―I am under a vow of vengeance.
尼は終生独身の誓いを立てる
Nuns take the vow of celibacy―Nums are under vows of celibacy.
血をすすって義兄弟の誓いを立てる
to drink each other's blood, and become sworn brothers
誓いを守る
to keep a vow―(禁酒の誓いなら)―keep the pledge
誓いを破る
to break a vow―break the pledge
神前の誓い
an oath taken before God―marriage-vows
神前の誓いを守る
to keep one's marriage-vows
神前の誓いを破る
to break one's marriage-vows
誓いを解く
to absolve one from a vow

content:
ちかい〔盟〕
〈名〉(=城下の盟)Surrender; capitulation

content.content: (敗北して)城下の盟いを成す
to capitulate―surrender―(to the enemy)
城下の盟いを成さしむ
to dictate the terms of peace to the vanquished enemy
城下の盟いを破る
to break faith―violate faith―with a Power

content:
ちがい〔違い〕
〈名〉Difference

content.content: これとあれとは大きな違い
There is a wide difference between this and that.
見ると聞くとは大きな違い
There is a great difference between the fame and reality―The reality falls far short of the fame.
両者の違いがわかるか
Do you see any difference between the two?
違いが少しもわからぬ
I can see no difference―fail to see any difference.
最後の五分間で勝利と敗北というほどの違いになる
The last five minutes make all the difference between victory and defeat.
兄とは三つ違いです
There is a three years' difference between my brother and me―My brother is three years older than I.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 三つ違いの兄さん
a brother three years older than I―my senior by three years
一つ二つの違いはどうでも好い
One or two more or less would make no difference.
そりゃ大違いだ(臆測が当たらぬ)
You have guessed wide―You are wide of the mark.
一毫の差千里の違い
An inch here will make miles there.→『ちがいない〔違いない〕』

content: 〈接尾詞〉［注意］訳語一定せず。

content.content: 当て違い
a disappointment
今度の先生には当て違いをした
We are disappointed in our new teacher.
甲と乙とは段違いだ
They are of different orders―A is no match for B―There is no comparison between the two.
ひと足違いで汽車に乗り後れた
I just missed the train.
ひと足違いで逢わなかった
I just missed meeting him.
君が出るとひと足違いで彼が来た
He came just after you went out.
人違い
a mistake of identity
人違いをする
to mistake one man for another―catch the wrong man―catch the wrong sow by the ear
そりゃお門違いだ
You have come to the wrong shop.
時代違い
an anachronism
仮名違い
a mispronunciation of a Japanese word
勘違い
a wrong guess
勘違いをする
to guess wrong―make a wrong guess―make a bad shot
鑑定違い
a misjudgment
鑑定違いする
to misjudge
見込違い
a miscalculation
見込違いする
to miscalculate
心得違い
a wrong action
心得違いする
to do wrong
見当違い
beside the mark
その返答は見当違いだ
You answer beside the mark.
君の推測はたいそう見当違いだ
Your guess is wide of the mark.
思い違い
a mistake―a misapprehension
僕の思い違いだった
I am mistaken.
君は妙な思い違いをしている
You labour under a strange mistake.
それは専門違いだ、商売違いだ
That is out of my line―out of my beat.
筋違い
unreason
その議論は筋違いだ
Your argument is against reason―contrary to reason―illogical.
腹違い
(兄弟なら)a half-brother―a half-sister―(子なら)―a child by a different mother
胤違い
(兄弟なら)a half-brother―a half-sister―(子なら)―a child by a different father
君は宗旨違いだ
You belong to a different faith.

content:
ちかいうちに〔近いうちに〕
〈副〉Shortly; before long; at an early date; at no distant date; one of these days

content.content: 近いうちに伺います
I shall call on you shortly.

ちがいだな〔違い棚〕
〈名〉A pair of opposite shelves (beside the alcove, one above the other, and the upper slightly overlapping the lower)

content:
ちがいない〔違いない〕
〈助動詞相当〉
1. Must

content.content: そうに違いない
It must be so―I am sure it is so―I have not doubt that it is so.
あの人は狂人に違いないと思った
I thought he must be mad―I concluded him to be mad.
それに違いない
There is no doubt about it―There is no mistake about it.
(どこを探しても無いから)ここにあるに違いない
It must be here―I am sure it is here.
君がそう言ったに違いない
You must have said so.
財布が無いから落としたに違いない
I must have dropped my purse.
彼は失敗するに違いない
He must fail―He will certainly fail―He is sure to fail―I am sure he will fail.
(何々には)違いないが(しかし)
Indeed―It is true―To be sure―Certainly―(... but...)
それは良い方法には違いないがしかし実行し難い
It is a good method, to be sure, but it is hard to practise.
これは不幸には違いないがたいした不幸じゃない
This is, certainly, a misfortune, but not a great one.

ちがいほうけん〔治外法権〕
〈名〉Extraterritoriality; extraterritorial jurisdiction

content:
ちかう〔誓う〕
〈自他動〉To swear, swear an oath, take an oath, make oath; to vow, make a vow, take the vows (of celibacy, etc.); to pledge one's honour, pledge one's word, plight one's word, give one's word, pass one's word; to pledge oneself, bind oneself (to something); to promise solemnly (to do something)

content.content: 誓ってこれを為さん
I swear that I will do it―I swear to do it―I vow to do it―I pledge myself to do it―I bind myself to do it―I'll do it,honour bright―May I die if I don't do it!
誓ってそうです
I swear―pledge my honour―pledge my word―give my word―that it is so.
誓って断言する
I solemnly affirm that it is so.
誓って本当だ
I solemnly affirm it to be true―swear that it is true―pledge my word that it is true.
男子の一言誓って本当だ
I give you my word of honour that it is true―Upon my word―Upon my honour―Upon my word of honour―Upon the word of a gentleman―it is true.
天に誓って(神明に誓って、弓矢八幡誓って)偽りではない(神もご照覧あれ)
I call Heaven to witness that I speak the truth―Witness Heaven that I speak the truth!―So help me God (as I speak the truth)!
今度は誓って成功する
I solemnly promise―give a solemn promise―that I will accomplish my purpose this time.
天に誓う、神かけて誓う、神仏に誓う
to swear by Heaven―swear by God―swear by the gods
神前に誓う
to take an oath before God―take the marriage-vows
忠順を誓う、恭順を誓う
to swear allegiance―vow allegiance―to one's sovereign―(封建時代なら)―take the oath of fealty―swear fealty―make fealty―do fealty―to one's liege lord
秘密を誓う
to pledge oneself to secrecy―bind oneself to secrecy―promise to keep the secret
秘密を誓わせる
to swear one to secrecy―bind one to secrecy
秘密を誓った(から言われぬ)
I am sworn to secrecy―bound to secrecy―pledged to secrecy―under pledge of secrecy―under a promise of secrecy.
秘密を誓ってその事を聞いた
He told me the truth under pledge of secrecy―under the seal of secrecy―under a promise of secrecy.
秘密を誓わして事実を明した
I disclosed the truth to him on a promise of secrecy―under the seal of secrecy―under pledge of secrecy.
禁酒を誓う
to swear off drinking―vow abstinence―sign the pledge―take the pledge
禁酒を誓った
I have taken the pledge―signed the pledge―vowed abstinence―I am under the vows of abstinence.
尼は終生独身を誓う
Nuns take the vows of celibacy―Nuns are under the vows of celibacy.
復讐を誓う
to vow vengeance―swear vengeance―against the enemy
彼は親の仇討を誓った
He has vowed to avenge his father.
誓って復讐する
I swear that I will be revenged―I swear to be revenged―I swear vengeance.
信義を誓う
to pledge one's faith―plight one's faith―give one's faith
二世を誓う(夫婦約束する)
to plight one's troth
共白髪を誓う(鴛鴦の契りを結ぶ)
to vow eternal fidelity
刎頸の交りを誓う、生涯の交誼を誓う
to vow eternal friendship
二心なきを誓う
to swear fidelity
赤誠を誓う
to swear sincerity
刀にかけて誓う
to swear on one's sword

content:
ちがう〔違う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=異なり)to differ (from the other); to be different (from each other) ［注意］“Different to”は英国人の誤り。

content.content: これとあれとは違う
This differs from that―This is different from that.
彼我の習慣が違う
Our customs differ from theirs―Our customs are different from theirs.
両者は大いに違う
They are widely different (from each other).
まったく違う、まるで違う、まるっきり違う
They are quite different―entirely different―(from each other).
別に違っていない
They do not differ in material respects―There is no material difference between the two.
その辺は日本と西洋とだいぶ違う
There is a great difference in that respect between Japan and the foreign countries.
解釈は人によって違う
The interpretation differs with different persons.
教授法は先生によって違う
The method of teaching differs with different teachers.
(高いとおっしゃるけれども)品が違います
The quality is different―The article is different in quality.
品が違うから値も違います
The articles are different in quality, and ought to be different in price.
場合が違う
The cases are different―The cases are not the same.
道が違うからいっしょに行けない
We are going different ways.
生徒と教師は目的が違う
The teacher and the student aim at different things―They are at cross purposes.
この二人は時代が違う
They lived in different ages―belong to different periods.
派が違う
They belong to different schools.
種が違う
They are different in kind―of different kinds.
肌が違う
They are cast in different moulds.
青山は方向が違う
Aoyama lies in a different direction.
専門家は着眼が違う
A professional man takes a different view of things―takes a professional view of things.
兄弟は腹が違う
They are by different mothers―half-brothers―half-sisters.
胤が違う
They are by different fathers―half-brothers―half-sisters.
甲乙は段が違う、役者が違う
They are of different orders―There is no comparison between the two.
(夫婦にしては)年が違い過ぎる
Their ages differ too much―They are too unequal in age―There is a wide disparity of age.
ある名詞は単数と複数で意味が違う
Some nouns have different meanings in the singular and plural.
二人は意見が違う
They differ in opinion―They are of different opinions―They hold different views.
僕は意見が違う
I am of a different opinion―I do not think so―I think otherwise.
僕は君と意見が違う
I must differ with you.
僕のみるところは違う
I do not view the matter in that light.
ペンの持ち方が違う
That is not the way to hold your pen.

content: 2. (=どちらにしても同じことではない)to make a difference

content.content: 商売は天気で違う
The weather does make a difference in the business―does matter to the business―does signify in respect of business.
芝居の入りは雨が降っても違わぬ
The rain makes no difference in the house―does not matter to the house.
(学校の席順などは)十年も絶つと違わぬ
It will make no difference ten years hence.
(兵は)訓練を受けると違う(受けないよりは好い)
Training does make a difference―Training is something―Training tells.
どうだ色男は違ったもんだろう
It is something to be a lady: killer, isn't it?
茶代をはずむと取扱いが違う
A big tea-money will make a difference in their hospitality―If you come down with a big tea-money, they will make much of you.

content: 3. (=多少違う)to vary (from the original); to deviate (from the rule); to diverge (from the normal standard)

content.content: 訳文と原文と違うところがある
The translation varies in places from the original.
どんな好い翻訳でも多少は原文と違うものだ
The best translation will vary (more or less) from the original.
収入は月によって違う
The receipts vary with the months.
値段は品によって違う
The price varies with the quality.
運賃は距離によって違う
The carriage varies with the distance.
小包料は遠近によって違いますか
Are the parcel-post charges variable according to the distance?

content: 4. (=どこか違う)(There is) something peculiar (about a person or thing)

content.content: あの人は普通の人間とどこか違う(ところがある)
There is something about him that distinguishes him from other men―There is something peculiar about him―(を略して)―There is something about him.
彼はどこも違ったところが無い
There is nothing peculiar about him.
あの先生はどこが違うとてあのようにもてはやされるのか
What is there about that man, that he should be made so much of?

content: 5. (=わけが違う)(That is) another thing

content.content: そうなるとわけが違う
That's another thing―That alters the case.
それとこれはわけが違う
That is one thing; this is another thing.
英語を使うと教えるとはわけが違う
To speak English is one thing; to teach it is quite another thing.
実行となるとわけが違う
When you come to practise it, it is another thing―(しゃれて言うと)―another pair of shoes.
あの人は口と腹と違う
He says one thing and means another―He does not mean what he says.

content: 6. (=物が違う)to be the wrong (person or thing)

content.content: (これじゃない)本が違う
You have brought the wrong book.
そりゃ汽車が違う
I have taken the wrong train.
(おかしいと思ったら)家が違う
I have entered the wrong house.
あわてて駆込んでみると家が違っていた
I took the wrong house in a fit of absent-mindedness.
(この人でない)人が違う
You have brought the wrong man―(しゃれて言うと)―caught the wrong sow by the ear.
今度は人が違っていない(この人だ)
You have brought the right man this time―caught the right sow by the ear at last.
お門か違います
You have come to the wrong shop―come to the wrong man.

content: 7. (=変ったから違う)to have changed

content.content: あの頃とは世の中が違う
The times have changed since then.
あの旅館は(代が変って)持主が違う
The hotel has changed hands.
君は違った人になった
You have become a changed man―another man.

content: 8. (=似ぬ)to be unlike (anything)

content.content: 弟は僕と違って朝起きだ(僕のように朝寝坊でない)
Unlike me, my brother is an early-riser―He is not a late riser, like me.
月とスッポンほど違う
They are as like as chalk and cheese.

content: 9. (=合わぬ)to disagree (with something); to be at variance (with each other)

content.content: 皆の話が違う
The accounts are at variance with one another―not at one with one another.
君の話は違うぜ
What you say, is at variance with what others say―The others do not say so.
品物が見本と違う
The goods do not agree with the sample―fall short of the sample.

content: 10. (=間違う)to be mistaken; to be wrong; to be incorrect; to be erroneous; to do (anything) amiss ［注意］動詞に“mis-”を加えて表すことあり。

content.content: 君の言うことは違っている
You are wrong.
この時計は違っている
The clock is wrong.
答案が違っている
The answer is wrong―incorrect.
綴りが違っている
The spelling is wrong―The word is wrongly spelt―erroneously spelt―misspelt.
手紙の番地が違っていたから届かなかった
The letter was wrongly addressed and miscarried.
見込が違った
I have calculated amiss―miscalculated.
鑑定が違った
I have judged amiss―misjudged.
違わぬ
to be right―correct―(時間なら)―punctual
あの人はいつも一分も違わぬ
He is always punctual to the minute.
寸分違わぬ
to be exact
勘定は一銭も違わぬ
The accounts are exact to the cent.
寸分違わず原作を写した
The original was exactly copied.
これは原作と寸分違わぬ
This is an exact copy of the original.
寸分違わずお指図通りにしました
I have obeyed your directions to the letter.
上衣は寸分違わず(キチンと)合います
The coat fits you to a nicety―to a T.

content: 11. (=行違う)to go wrong

content.content: 山が違った
My speculation has gone wrong―failed.
当てが違う
to be disappointed of one's expectations―reckon without one's host
褒美を貰おうと思ったら当てが違った
I am disappointed of my reward.

content: 12. (=反する)to be against (anything); to be contrary to (anything)

content.content: そりゃ筋が違う
That is contrary to reason―against reason―illogical.
気が違う
to go mad
彼は気が違っている
He is mad―insane.
彼は気でも違いはせんかと思った
I feared for his reason.

content:
14. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: こりゃ約束が違う
This is not what we agreed upon―I did not bargain for this.
血を分けた仲は他人と違う
“Blood is thicker than water.”
いざという場合には訓練の有ると無いとは違う
Training tells in the moment of peril.
そうなると話が違う
That alters the case.
話は違うが、帝劇では何をやっているかね
By the bye, what are they playing at the Imperial?
そりゃ違う
I is not so.

content:
ちがえる〔違える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=変える)to change (anything); to disguise (one's hand, etc.)

content.content: 服装を違える
to change one's dress
服装を違えて来た
He came in a different dress.
手を違えて書く
to disguise one's hand
手を違えて書いてある
The hand is disguised―It is written in a disguised hand.
路を違える
to take a different road
路を違えて行った
I went by a different road.

content: 2. (=ぶっちがえる)to cross (two sticks) with each other

content.content: 旗竿を違える
to cross two flagstaffs
刺し違える、刺し違えて死ぬ
to stab each other―die by each other's hand
足などの骨を違える
to dislocate a foot―put a foot out of joint
頸を寝違える
to crick one's neck

content: 4. (=背く)to break (one's promise)

content.content: 決して約束を違えるようなことはしない
I will never break my promise.
日限を違える
to be unpunctual
あの人は決して日限を違えぬ
He is always punctual.

content: 5. (=何々して違える)to make a mistake (in doing anything) ［注意］概して動詞に副詞(wrong, amiss)を加えるかまたは接頭詞(mis-)を付す。

content.content: 見違える
to see anything wrong―see anything amiss―miss-see anything
君は見違えるほど変った
I should not know you if I met you in the streets―Your own mother would not know you.
聞き違える
to hear anything wrong―hear anything amiss―mishear anything
君は僕の言うことを聞き違えたのだろう
You must have misheard me.
読み違える
to read anything wrong―read anything amiss―misread anything
書き違える
to write anything wrong―write anything amiss―miswrite anything
意味をとり違える
to mistake the meaning
甲と乙を思い違える
to take one thing for another
ロシア人は自由と放恣をはき違えた
The Russians mistook liberty for license.
誤って汽車を乗り違えた
I took the wrong train by mistake.
誤って薬を飲み違えた
I took the wrong medicine by mistake.
踏み違える
to tread amiss―tread awry―make a false step―(より)―err from the right path―stray from the path of right

content:
ちかく〔近く〕
〈副〉
1. Near; nearly:(前置詞に用いれば)near (a place)

content.content: 僕は近くにいる
I live near.
この近くにいる
I live near here―in this neighbourhood.
学校の近くにいる
I live near the school.
学校のじき近くにいる
I live near by the school―close by the school―just by the school―hard by the school.
じき近くに宿を取った
I have taken up my lodgings near by―close by―just by―hard by.
百人近く集まった
Nearly a hundred men came together.
遠からん者は音にも聞け
Ye who are afar, hear and tremble!
近くば寄って目にも見よ
Ye who are near, behold and wonder!

content: 2. (=近頃)lately; of late

content.content: あれは近く米国から帰った人だ
He is lately returned from America.

content:
ちかく〔知覚〕
〈名〉
1. (=覚ること)perception:(=する) to perceive

content.content: 知覚器官
the organs of perception
知覚神経
the sensory nerve

content: 2. (=意識)consciousness:(=する) to be conscious of (something)

content.content: 知覚を失う(人事不省に陥る、気絶する)
to lose one's consciousness―fall unconscious―fall insensible―fall senseless―fall into a swoon―swoon―faint

ちかく〔地殻〕
〈名〉The earth's crust

ちかくしんけい〔知覚神経〕
〈名〉The sensory nerve

content:
ちかごろ〔近頃〕
〈副〉
1. Lately; of late; recently:(=の) late; recent

content.content: 近頃はよく雨が降る
It has rained much lately.
近頃は彼に少しも会わない
I have seen nothing of him of late.
彼は近頃来たばかりだ
It is only lately―but lately―that he came.
つい近頃のことだ
It happened but lately―quite recently.
彼が帰朝したのはつい近頃のことだ
It was but lately that he returned from abroad.
近頃まで
till lately―up to a short time ago

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: そりゃ近頃の珍聞だ
That's news indeed!
近頃珍しい壮観であった
It was such a sight as had not been seen for many a year―the finest sight Tokyo had seen for years.
近頃珍しい大雪であった
It was such a snowfall as had not been seen for many a year―It was the greatest snowfall that had been seen for years―Such a snowfall had not been known for years.

content: 2. (=当節)in these days; nowadays

content.content: あんな学者は近頃珍しい
Such scholar are rarely to be met with nowadays.
あんな勉強家は近頃の若い者には珍しい
Such a hard worker is rarely found among young men nowadays.

content:
ちかしい〔近しい〕
〈形〉Intimate (friend); close (friendship)

content.content: 近しい友達
an intimate friend
近しい交り
close friendship
彼とは近しくしている
I am on intimate terms with him.
二人は近しい仲だ
They are on intimate terms with each other―bound by close friendship―intimate friends―Intimate relations subsist between the two.
非常に近しい
They are hand and glove with each other―as thick as thieves.
彼は人と近しくしない
He keeps people at a distance―keeps people at arm's length.
近しき仲にも礼儀あり
Do not forget decorum in familiarity.

content:
ちかしつ〔地下室〕
〈名〉An underground room; a basement; a cellar

content.content: この下は地下室になっている
There is a cellar under us.
銀行の地下室に洋食屋がある
There is a foreign restaurant in the basement of the bank.

ちかせん〔地下戦〕
〈名〉Subterranean warfare; underground operations

ちかせん〔地下線〕
〈名〉An underground cable

ちがたな〔血刀〕
〈名〉A bloody sword

content:
ちかぢかに〔近々に〕
〈副〉Shortly; before long; at an early date; at no distant date; one of these days

content.content: 近々に開校になります
The school will be opened at an early date.

content:
ちかづき〔近付き〕
〈名〉(事)acquaintance:(人)an acquaintance

content.content: 人と近づきになる
to get acquainted with a person―make acquaintance with a person―make one's acquaintance
君は彼とどうして近づきになったか
How did you get acquainted with him?―make his acquaintance?
彼は誰とでもどうかこうか近づきになる
He scrapes acquaintance with everybody.
どうぞお近づきを願います
I request the pleasure of your acquaintance.

content:
ちかづきがたい〔近付き難い〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: ちかづきにくい〔近付きにくい〕

content:
ちかづきにくい〔近付きにくい〕
〈形〉Inaccessible (to one)

content.content: あの人は誰にでも近づきにくい
He is inaccessible―difficult of access―to everybody.

content:
ちかづきやすい〔近付きやすい〕
〈形〉Accessible (to one)

content.content: あの人は誰にでも近づきやすい
He is accessible―easy of access―to everybody.

content:
ちかづく〔近付く〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=近寄る)to draw near, approach (with or without design); to draw nigh (without design)

content.content: 試験が近づいた
The examination draws nigh―The examination is close at hand.
学期が終りに近づく
The term draws to a close.
船が陸に近づく
A ship comes in sight of land―sights land―makes land.
船が海岸に近づく
A ship stands in (for the shore).

content: 2. (=近づきになる)to get acquainted with (one); to make one's acquaintance

content.content: あの人は近づきやすい
He is accessible―easy of access―to everybody.
近づきにくい
He is inaccessible―difficult of access―to everybody.

content:
ちかづける〔近付ける〕
〈他動〉To let (people) come near (one); to make oneself accessible to (people); to seek the society of (some people); to keep company with (some questionable people)

content.content: 女を近づける
to keep company with women
あの人は誰れでも近づける
He is accessible to everybody.
誰も近づけぬ
He is inaccessible to everybody.
人を近づけぬ
to keep people at a distance―keep people at arm's length―keep people at bay
あんな奴らを近づけるな
You must keep such fellows at a distance.
彼は下々の者を近づけない
He keeps his inferiors at arm's length.
凶漢は短刀を振廻して追手を近づけなかった
The ruffian brandished a knife, and kept his pursuers at bay.
鹿は追い詰められると角を向けて猟犬を近づけない
The stag keeps the hounds at bay.

ちかてつどう〔地下鉄道〕
〈名〉An underground railway

content:
ちかみち〔近路、近道〕
〈名〉
1. (=近い道)a shorter road; a short cut:(角を曲らずに切る近道)a cut-off:(=する) to take a short cut (across the field); to cot across the field; to strike across the field; to cut off a corner

content.content: この練兵場を通る近道は無いか
Is there no short cut across the parade-ground?
この寺の境内を抜ける近道がある
There is a short cut across the precincts of the temple.
角を曲らず近道をしよう
Let us cut off the corner.

content: 2. (=早道)a nearer way, a royal road (to some goal)

content.content: この本を使った方が近道だ
It would be a nearer way to use this book.
人を知るは酒が近道
Wine is the nearlest way to knowledge of character.
英語を修める近道は無いか
Is there no royal road to English?
彼は近道をして邪道に入った
He tried to get money without working for it.

content:
ちかみち〔近路、近道〕
〈名〉
1. (=近い道)a shorter road; a short cut:(角を曲らずに切る近道)a cut-off:(=する) to take a short cut (across the field); to cot across the field; to strike across the field; to cut off a corner

content.content: この練兵場を通る近道は無いか
Is there no short cut across the parade-ground?
この寺の境内を抜ける近道がある
There is a short cut across the precincts of the temple.
角を曲らず近道をしよう
Let us cut off the corner.

content: 2. (=早道)a nearer way, a royal road (to some goal)

content.content: この本を使った方が近道だ
It would be a nearer way to use this book.
人を知るは酒が近道
Wine is the nearlest way to knowledge of character.
英語を修める近道は無いか
Is there no royal road to English?
彼は近道をして邪道に入った
He tried to get money without working for it.

content:
ちかめ〔近目〕
〈名〉Near-sightedness; short sight; myopia:(=の) near-sighted; short-sighted

content.content: あの人はひどい近目だ
He is dreadfully near-sighted.

content:
ちかよる〔近寄る〕
〈自他動〉To draw near, approach (with or without design); to draw nigh (without design)

content.content: 彼我の軍勢が近寄った
The armies drew near―approached each other.
行列が近寄って来た
The procession drew nigh.
船が陸に近寄る
A ship comes in sight of land―sights land―makes land.
船が海岸に近寄る
A ship stands in (for the shore).
君子危きに近寄らず
The wise man does not court danger―You should keep out of harm's way.

content:
ちから〔力〕
〈名〉
1. (=体力)strength; might; force

content.content: あの人は力が有る、力が強い
He is strong―mighty.
力自慢だ
He prides himself on his strength.
力が無い、力が弱い
He is weak―feeble.
力は十人力有る
He has the strength of ten men.
力が足りない
He is not strong enough (to do the work).
力を出す
to put forth one's strength
有らん限りの力を出す
to put forth all one's strength
出そうと思っても力が出ない
My strength fails me.
仕事が力に余る
The task is beyond my strength―too much for me.
力に余る仕事はせぬがよい
You must not attempt a task beyond your strength.
力いっぱい、力の限り働く
I will work with all my might―with might and main.
力にまかして引張った
I pulled with all my strength―with all my might―by main force.
あの相撲は(手が無いから)力ずくで勝つ
He wins by sheer strength.
くやしかったら力で来い
If you are vexed at what I say, stand up to me in a fair trial of strength.
団結は力なり
Union is strength.

content: 2. (=威力)force; power

content.content: 下瀬火薬は力が強い
Shimose powder is powerful.
蒸気の力
the power of steam
電気の力
the power of electricity
爆発物の力
the power of an explosive
爆発の力
the force of explosion
力の強い爆発薬
a powerful explosive
力に及ぶ、力に及ばぬ
to be in one's power―beyond one's power
彼を救うことは力に及ばぬ
It is beyond my power to save him.
力に及ぶだけの手段を尽した
I have tried every means in my power.
力に及ぶ限りやってみよう
I will do my utmost―do all I can―do all that lies in my power―do all that in me lies―I will try, so far as in me lies, to do it―I shall endeavour to do it to the best of my power.
金銭は世を益する力ともなり世を害する力ともなる
Money may be a power for good or a power for evil.
力抜山気蓋世{ちからやまをぬき、きはよをおおう}
His power can hurl mountains, and his spirit dominates the world―He has a mountain-hurling power and a world-dominating spirit.
智識は力なり
Knowledge is power.

content: 3. (=権力)power; authority

content.content: 大家の言は力がある
He speaks with authority.

content: 4. (=自然力)energy; force

content.content: 熱は力なり
Heat is a form of energy.

content: 5. (=精力)energy

content.content: 力を出す
to put forth one's energy―put forth one's effort

content: 6. (=能力)powers; abilities

content.content: 精神の力(才能)
mental powers
力を表わす
to display one's powers―exhibit one's abilities

content: 7. (=学力、実力)ability; proficiency

content.content: この仕事は力に余る
The task exceeds my ability.
力が足らぬ
My ability is inadequate to the task―I am wanting in ability.
力の足らないことは承知です
I am conscious of my want of ability.
力の足らないところは勉強で補う
I make up by diligence for my want of ability.
力の有らん限りやってみましょう
Will do all I can―I shall endeavour to the best of my ability.
読書の力
reading ability
日本の書生は英語を話すことは下手な代りに読書の力がある
Japanese students speak English poorly, but they have reading ability.
この本は力がつく
This book will give you reading ability―This book has a training virtue―This book contains culture.
読書の力を養う
to train oneself to read difficult authors
語学の力
linguistic ability―linguistic proficiency
英語の力がつく
to become proficient in English
彼の英語の力には敬服だ
I admire his proficiency in English.

content: 8. (=努力、尽力)efforts; exertions; endeavours

content.content: 力を尽す
to make efforts―use exertions―exert oneself―do one's best endeavours―do one's best―do one's utmost
目的を達するためには力を尽します
I shall endeavour to attain my object―strive to accomplish my purpose.
畢生の力を尽す
to strive with all one's might―strive to the utmost
人のために力を尽す
to exert oneself―use one's influence―in behalf of some one
彼は僕のために力を尽してくれた
He has exerted himself in my behalf.
力を合わせる
to unite efforts―join forces
力を合わして
by united efforts
兄弟力を合わして本懐を遂げた
The object was attained by the united efforts of the brothers.

content: 9. (=気力)spirit; courage; heart

content.content: 力を落とす
to lose heart―be disheartened―be discouraged―be dispirited―be dejected―be cast down
この困難を見ると力を落とす
My heart fails me―My heart sinks within me―My heart dies within me―at the sight of the difficulties.
ひどく力を落とす
to break one's heart―have one's heart broken
彼は一人息子に死なれてひどく力を落としている
He is broken-hearted―dreadfully cut up―disconsolate―over the death of his only son.
これしきのことに力を落とすな
You must not lose heart―be discouraged―over such trifles.
一度の失敗くらいに力を落しちゃいられない
I can not afford to be discouraged by―be disheartened by―a single failure.
力をつける
to encourage a person
力をつける言葉
encouraging words
力を得る
to take heart
その言葉に力を得た
I took heart at his words―I was encouraged by his words.

content: 10. (=助力)assistance; aid; help

content.content: 力を貸す、力を添える
to help one―aid one―assist one―lend one assistance―render one aid―lend one a hand―stretch a helping hand―give one a lift―come to one's aid―cooperate with one
力を借りる
to be helped―be aided―be assisted―receive assistance―receive aid―get help
人の力になる
to support one―sustain one―hold one up―back one up―stand by one―stand one's friend―become one's staff
(まさかの時には)お互いに力になろうじゃないか
Let us stand by each other in time of need.
(僕は困っているから)力になってくれ給え
I wish you would stand my friend.
力になってやろう
I will stand your friend―You shall find a friend in me.
早く大きくなってお父様のお力におなりなさい
You must grow up to be the staff of your father's declining years.
人を力にする、力と頼む
to look to me for assistance―depend on one―rely upon one
君は人を力にするのはよくない
You ought not to depend on others.
ああいう友人は力になる
He is to be depended upon―He will not fail you.
力にならぬ
He is not to be depended upon―He will fail you.
彼は力と頼む息子に死なれた
He lost his son who was his sole dependence―his only hope.
英国の力と頼むものは海軍のみ
The navy is England's sole dependence―England's only resort.
力と頼んだ友人が東京を去ったと聞く悲しさ
I found, to my disappointment, that the man to whom I looked for assistance had left Tokyo.

content: 11. (=効力)effect; efficiency; force; power:(議論の力なら)cogency; weight; point

content.content: 彼の弁舌は人を動かす力がある
He speaks with effect―He is an effective speaker.
力ある演説であった
It was an effective speech.
力ある文章
a powerful style
力ある筆
a powerful pen
力ある議論
a forcible argument―a cogent argument―a convincing argument
そんな議論は下層社会に対して力がある
Such argument have weight with the masses―have force with the masses.
彼の言うことは力がない
His words lack point.
実行がなければ言うことに力がない
One's deeds must give point to one's words.
彼は実行するから言葉に力がある
His deeds give point to his words.
(実例などをもって)教訓に力を添える
to point a moral

content: 12. (=資力)means

content.content: 罹災者の中に復興の力のある者は半分あるまい
No half the sufferers have the means of reconstruction.

content: 13. (=語勢)emphasis; stress

content.content: 言葉に力を入れる
to emphasize one's words―lay stress on a word

content: 14. (=強音)accent

content.content: この語は何節に力が入るか
On which syllable is the word accented?
二節に力を入れる
to accent the second syllable

content: 15. (=筆に入れる力)boldness

content.content: 筆に力を入れる
to make a bold stroke
筆に力がある
The strokes are bold.

content:
16. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 腕に力を入れる
to strain the arm
下腹に力を入れる
to strain the abdomen
義太夫は声に力が入る
The Gidayu strains the voice.
力を入れて舟をこぐ
to bend to one's oar
仕事に力を入れる
to bend to one's work
力が尽きた
I am exhausted.
途中で力が尽きて倒れた者がある
Some gave out on the way.
(嵐や弾丸などの)力が尽きる
to spend itself
風の力が尽きた
The storm is spent.
力の尽きた弾
a spent ball
(力を出そうと待ちかまえていたことがはずれて)力が抜ける
One is disappointed of expectation―One looks blank.
二人は力が違う
A is no match for B―B is more than a match for A―B is an overmatch for A―There is no comparison between the two.
味噌汁は力がつく
Miso-pottage is sustaining.
力のつく食物
sustaining food→『あずかってちからあり〔与って力あり〕』

ちからあわせ〔力合わせ〕
〈名〉Cooperation; united efforts

content:
ちからいっぱい〔力一杯〕
〈副〉With all one's might

content.content: 力いっぱい働く
to work with all one's might―work with might and main

content:
ちからおとし〔力落し〕
〈名〉Discouragement; broken-heartedness; disconsolateness

content.content: 一人息子に死なれて非常な力落しだ
He is broken-hearted―disconsolate―dreadfully cut up―over the loss of his only son.
さぞお力落しでしょう
You must feel your loss―I know how you must feel.

ちからかぎりこんかぎり

ちからかぎりこんかぎり〔力限り根限り〕

〈他動〉(=治療する)to cure (a disease―a person of a disease)
〈自動〉(=執政する)to govern

content.content: 国王は統すれども治せず
“The king reigns, but does not govern.”

content:
ちせい〔治世〕
〈名〉Reign; rule

content.content: 明治天皇の治世にあった事だ
It happened in the reign of Meiji Tenno.
明治天皇の治世には種々の出来事があった
Many events happened during the reign of Meiji Tenno.
徳川幕府の治世に
under the rule of the Tokugawas―under the Shogunate

content:
ちせい〔地勢〕
〈名〉Topography; natural features (of a country, etc.)

content.content: 日本の地勢
the natural features of Japan
地勢を探る
to feel the ground

ちせい〔智性〕
〈名〉［心理］The intellect

content:
ちそ〔地租〕
〈名〉Land-tax

content.content: 千円の地租を納める
to pay a land-tax of 1000 yen

ちそう〔地層〕
〈名〉A stratum:(総称すれば)the strata of the earth's crust:(田畑などの地層は)a layer (of earth)

content:
ちそう〔馳走〕
〈名〉
1. (=饗応)an entertainment; a feast; a f?te; a treat; a spread; a repast; a dinner:(=する) to entertain (one at dinner); to regale (one with wine); to feast (one); to f?te (one); to treat (one to good things); to give (one) a treat; to stand (something); to stand treat

content.content: 今日はお祝いにご馳走しよう(奢ろう)
I will give you a treat―stand treat―in honour of the occasion.
何をご馳走しようか
What shall I treat you to?
何かうまい物をご馳走したまえ
Treat us to something good.
シャンペンを一本ご馳走しよう
I will treat you to champagne―stand a bottle of champagne.
ご馳走になる、ご馳走にあずかる
to be feasted―be f?ted―be entertained―be favoured with an entertainment―partake of a repast―break bread with one
僕もご馳走のご相伴にあずかった
I partook of the repast.
それではご馳走になろう
Then I shall partake of your entertainment.
うまいものをご馳走になった
We were treated to good things.
蕎麦をご馳走になった
We were treated to buckwheat.
酒をご馳走になった
We were regaled with wine.
ご馳走に人を招く
to invite people to dinner―give a dinner
彼は人を呼んでご馳走することが好きだ
He likes to give dinners.
ご馳走に招かれる
to be invited to dinner
ご馳走を十分に(十二分に)頂戴した
We have done justice to the dinner―done ample justice to the repast.
たいそうなご馳走だった
It was a royal entertainment―a grand feast―a splendid spread―no end of a spread―a capital dinner.
たいしたご馳走でない
It is not much of an entertainment―not much of a spread―not much of a dinner.
寒い時は焚火は何よりのご馳走です
A blazing fire is a treat―a luxury―to the frozen traveller.
心ばかりのご馳走です
It is an entertainment only meant to show my good will.
ご馳走になったも同然です(お志でたくさん)
I will take the will for the deed.
ご馳走はそう綺麗に喰うものでない
You should not like your dish clean.
ご馳走は体裁に少し残すものだ
You should leave some for manners' sake.
ご馳走さま
Thanks for your entertainment!―(とは通例言わずして)―I have enjoyed myself very much―I have enjoyed the evening―(など言う).
ご馳走政略で人気を取る
to feast oneself into popularity―feed oneself into favour
ご馳走政略
feasting policy―feeding policy
ご馳走を食って楽しむ
to make merry

content: 2. (=うまい物)good cheer; good fare; good things; luxuries; viands; dishes; dainty dishes; eatables and drinkables

content.content: ご馳走を出す
to provide good cheer
何ご馳走を出そうか
What good things―What luxuries―shall I provide?
ご馳走が出る
Good cheer is provided―Good cheer appears―Good cheer makes its appearance.
ご馳走が出ました、さァ頂戴しよう
There is good cheer on the table. Let us fall to!
ご馳走を食う
to make good cheer―make merry
ご馳走にありつく
to find good cheer―fare well
こんなご馳走にありつくことはめったに無い
I seldom find such good cheer―I rarely fare so well.
ご馳走を強いる
to press good cheer upon one
田舎へ行くとご馳走を強いられるのは有難迷惑だ
It is a mistaken kindness on the part of country folk to press the good cheer upon you.
食卓にご馳走を並べる
to spread the dishes on the table―spread the table with dainty dishes
ご馳走の並んだ食卓
a table spread with dainty dishes―a daintily spread table
何かご馳走があるか
Have you any good things?
ご馳走は山ほど出る(ご馳走山の如し)
We have a power of good things―a groaning hoard―“The boards groan under the sumptuous dishes.”
何もご馳走はありません
We have nothing to offer you―You must put up with poor fare―Ours is but humble fare.
復讐は神のご馳走なり(と Spain 人言う)
“Revenge is a dish for the gods.”

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 有り合わせのご馳走
pot-luck
ほんの有り合わせのご馳走です
You must take pot-luck with us.
ご馳走は食い放題
You may eat as much as you like―You shall have the run of the pantry.
日本料理は目のご馳走
Japanese cooking is intended to please the eye.
空腹は何よりのご馳走
“Hunger is the best sauce.”

content: 3. (=もてなし)hospitality

content.content: それではしばらくご馳走になりましょう
Then I shall enjoy your hospitality for a while.
そういつまでも友人のご馳走にばかりなっておられぬ
I can not impose upon the hospitality of my friends for ever.
荷主の食事は船長のご馳走です
The owner of the cargo enjoys the captain's hospitality.
あの人はご馳走好きだ
He is very hospitable―hospitality itself―He keeps a good table―keeps a good house―keeps open house.

ちそく〔遅速〕
〈名〉
1. (=速力の遅速)speed
2. (=進度の遅速)progress
3. (=時間の遅速)want of punctuality

content:
ちたい〔地帯〕
〈名〉A zone

content.content: 安全地帯
a safety-zone
中立地帯
a neutral zone

content:
ちたい〔遅滞〕
〈名〉
1. Procrastination; delay:(=する) to procrastinate; to delay; to put off

content.content: 事遅滞を許さず
The matter admits of no delay.
遅滞無く回答ありたし
Please answer without delay―promptly.

content: 2. (=納金などの遅滞)arrearage:(=する) to fall into arrears

content.content: 納税が遅滞している
The taxes are in arrears.

content:
ちだい〔地代〕
〈名〉Land-rent; ground-rent

content.content: 地代を取立てる
to collect land-rent
この辺は地代は坪いくらか
What is the land-rent per tsubo in these parts?
地代と家賃
land-rent and house-rent―the rents
地代や家賃が高い、安い
The rents are high or low.
地代や家賃が上がる、下がる
The rents rise or fall.
地代や家賃を上げる、下げる
to raise the rents―lower the rents
彼は地代がいくら上がるか
What has he from the land-rent?
地代が一万円上がる
He has 10,000 yen from the land-rent.

content:
ちだつ〔褫奪〕
〈名〉Deprivation:(=する) to deprive (a man of anything)

content.content: 官職を褫奪する
to deprive a man of his office

content:
ちだらけ〔血だらけ〕
〈形〉Covered with blood; bloody (sword, etc.)

content.content: その男は血だらけになって倒れておった
He lay covered all over with blood.
血だらけの刀をさげて立っておった
He stood with a bloody sword in his hand.
血だらけの死骸
a gory corpse

content:
ちち〔遅々〕
〈副〉Slowly

content.content: 老艦は遅々として進まず
The old ship is very slow.
工事は遅々として進まぬ
The works make slow progress―progress at a snail's pace.

content:
ちち〔乳〕
〈名〉
1. Milk

content.content: 子どもが乳を飲む
A child sucks milk―sucks its mother's milk―sucks its mother―draws the breasts.
子どもに乳を飲ませる
to suckle a child―give suck to a child―give a child to suck
母が(乳母を雇わずに)自分の乳で子を育てる
A mother nurses her own child.
乳が出る
Milk flows.
乳が出なくなる
Milk ceases to flow―One's breasts run dry.
乳を離す
to wean a child
乳を離れる
A child is weaned (from its mother).
お母さんの乳が飲みたくなったのだ
He wants his mother's milk―He is homesick.
泣く子に乳だ
That is the very thing―just the thing.

content: 2. (=牛乳)cow's milk

content.content: 子どもを牛の乳で育てる
to feed a baby on cow's milk―bring up a child on the bottle―bring up a child by the hand
子どもが牛の乳でよく育つ
The baby thrives on cow's milk.
牛の乳を搾る
to milk a cow
この牛は乳が出るか
Is the cow in milk?
牛の乳が出なくなる
A cow runs dry.

content: 3. (=乳房)the breasts

content.content: 乳が張る
The breasts fill.

content:
ちち〔父〕
〈名〉A father:(=の) paternal

content.content: 父は不在です
My father is away―Father is out.
子どもの父
the father of the child
彼はその子を父のように世話をして(我が子のように世話をして、第二の父になった)
He was a father to the child―a second father to the child.
この父にしてこの子あり
The son is worthy of the father―Like father, like son.
父に好く似た子だ
He is a chip of the old block.
父方の親類です
We are related on my father's side―related on the paternal side―related on the spear side―He is a paternal relation.

content:
ちぢ〔千々〕
〈形〉Myriad; diverse

content.content: 心を千々に砕く
to rack one's brains―tax one's ingenuity
月見れば
When I gaze on the lucid moon
千々にものこそ悲しけれ
A myriad mournful thoughts revive,
我が身一つの
Although not unto me alone
秋にはあらねど
The autumn season doth arrive.

content:
ちちかた〔父方〕
〈名〉One's father's side; the paternal side:(=の) paternal

content.content: 父方の親類です
We are related on my father's side―related on the paternal side―related on the spear side―He is a paternal relation.

content:
ちぢかむ〔縮かむ〕
〈自動〉To huddle oneself up

content.content: 皆寒がってちぢんでいる
They are huddled up with cold.
ちぢかんで火にばかり当たっている
They cower over the fire―nurse the fire―hug the fire.

content:
ちちきょうだい〔乳兄弟〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ちきょうだい〔乳兄弟〕

content:
ちちくさい〔乳臭い〕
〈形〉Still smelling of mother's milk; green, callow, unfledged, inexperienced (youth)

content.content: 乳臭いお嬢さん
a bread-and-butter miss

ちちくび〔乳首〕
〈名〉The nipple, the teat, the pap (of a woman); the dug (of a cow)

ちちくりあい〔乳繰合い〕
〈名〉(Young people's) illicit intercourse, improper connection, love-making:(=する) to have improper connection; to make love to each other

content:
ちちくりあう〔乳繰合う〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: ちちくりあい〔乳繰合い〕

ちぢこまる〔縮こまる〕
〈自動〉To cower; to crouch

content:
ちちばなれ〔乳離れ〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ちばなれ〔乳離れ〕

ちぢませる〔縮ませる〕
〈他動〉To crinkle (cloth); to crimp (slices of raw fish in cold water)

content:
ちぢまる〔縮まる〕
〈自動〉
1. To contract; to shorten; to shrink

content.content: 筋肉が縮まる
Muscles contract.
怖がって縮まる
One shrinks for fear.
命が縮まる
Life shortens―Life is shortened.
寿命が縮まるような思いをした
I had an experience likely to shorten my natural term of existence.
あの夜の心配で五六年は寿命が縮まった
That anxious night has shortened my natural term of existence by five or six years.
苦労をすると寿命が縮まる
“Care preys upon life”―“Care killed the cat.”

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 靴が縮まって足が痛い
My shoes draw.

content: 2. (=縮かむ)to huddle oneself up

content.content: 身が縮まるほど寒い
It is so cold that you huddle yourself up―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The cold huddles you up.

content:
ちぢみ〔縮み〕
〈名〉Crinkled cloth; cotton crape

content.content: 縮みのシャツ
a shirt of cotton crape

content:
ちぢみあがる〔縮み上がる〕
〈自動〉To shrink (for fear); to quail (beneath one's glance); to wince (under pain); to flinch (under a threat); to be doubled up (with pain); to cower

content.content: 彼は女ににらまれて縮み上がった
He quailed beneath her glance.
手術を受けて(痛がって)縮み上がっている
He winces under the knife―winces under pain.
弾を一発受けて縮み上がってしまった
He was doubled up by a shot―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A shot doubled him up.

content:
ちぢむ〔縮む〕
〈自動〉To contract; to shrink; to shorten; to crinkle; to be crimped

content.content: 筋肉が縮む
Muscles contract.
毛織は洗濯すると縮む
Woollen cloth shrink with washing.
縮緬が縮む
Crape crinkles.
魚は洗いにすると縮む
Slices of raw fish are crimped in cold water.

content:
ちぢめる〔縮める〕
〈他動〉To contract (a muscle); to shorten (a course); to reduce (the term); to abridge (a book); to condense (a sentence); to cut down (the holidays); to draw in (one's legs, etc.)

content.content: あの人は人の悪口を言っておいてくびを縮める癖がある
He has a way of drawing in his head after abusing a man.
帆を縮める
to shorten sail
文章を縮める
to abridge a composition―(文法の一文なら)―condense a sentence
修業年限を縮める
to shorten the term of study―reduce the term of study
命を縮める
to shorten one's life
あんな思いをすると寿命を縮める
Such an experience will shorten one's natural term of existence.
あの夜の心配で五六年は寿命を縮めている
That anxious night has shortened my natural term of existence by five or six years.
君は(そんな無理をすると)寿命を縮めるぞ
You are driving a nail into your coffin―adding a nail to your coffin.
苦労は寿命を縮める
“Care preys upon life”―“Care is a foe to life”―“Care killed the cat.”
貴様は(俺にこんな苦労をかけて)親の寿命を縮める奴だ
You will bring yours father's gray hairs to the grave.

ちちゅうかい〔地中海〕
〈固名〉The Mediterranean (Sea)

ちぢらす〔縮らす〕
〈他動〉To curl, frizzle (one's hair)

content:
ちぢれけ〔縮れ毛〕
〈名〉Curly hair; curled hair; curls; frizzled hair; wavy hair

content.content: あの女は縮れ毛だ
She has wavy hair.

content:
ちぢれる〔縮れる〕
〈自動〉To curl; to frizzle; to be wavy

content.content: 西洋人は毛が縮れている
Foreigners have curly fair.
あの西洋婦人の髪は細かに縮れている
That foreign lady has frizzled hair.

ちっきょ〔蟄居〕
〈名〉
1. Seclusion; hibernation:(=する) to live a secluded life; to live in seclusion; to hibernate; to keep the house; to keep indoors
2. (=徳川時代の刑罰)Domiciliary confinement

content:
ちっこう〔築港〕
〈名〉Harbour construction:(=する) to construct a harbour

content.content: 東京湾築港
the construction of Tokyo harbour
築港工事
harbour-works

ちっし〔窒死〕
〈名〉Death by suffocation:(=する) to be suffocated to death; to be choked to death; to be stifled to death; to be smothered to death

content:
ちつじょ〔秩序〕
〈名〉
1. Order; system; method

content.content: 秩序整然たり
Everything is in perfect order―Perfect order is maintained.
秩序紊乱
Things are in disorder―disorderly.
秩序を保つ
(治者なら取締る)to keep order―preserve order―maintain order―(被治者なら慎む)―keep good order.
秩序を乱す(狂わす)
to disturb order―throw anything into disorder―throw anything out of order―derange anything
社会の秩序を乱す
to disturb public order
秩序を正す(整える)
to put anything in order―bring anything into order―put anything to rights
秩序を回復する
to restore order
秩序回復す
Order is restored.
安寧秩序を回復する
to restore peace and order―(を通例)―law and order
秩序を立てる
to reduce anything to order―reduce anything to system―reduce anything to method―methodize anything―systematize anything
彼の為すことは秩序が立っている
He does everything on system―Everything he does is systematic―methodical―business-like.
彼の為すことは秩序が立たぬ
There is no system or method in what he does―Everything he does, is unsystematic―unmethodical―unbusiness-like.

content:
ちっそ〔窒素〕
〈名〉Nitrogen:(=の) nitrogenous

content.content: 窒素性の食物
nitrogenous food
窒素計
a nitrometer

content:
ちっそく〔窒息〕
〈名〉Asphyxiation; suffocation:(=する) to be asphyxiated; to be suffocated; to be choked; to be stifled; to be smothered:(=させる) to asphyxiate; to suffocate; to choke; to stifle; to smother

content.content: 煙のために窒息する
to be suffocated by smoke―choked with smoke―stifled with smoke
窒息して死ぬ
to be suffocated to death―choked to death―stifled to death―smothered to death
窒息ガス
asphyxiating gas

content:
ちっちょく〔黜陟〕
〈名〉Promotion and degradation:(=する) to promote or degrade

content.content: 部下黜陟の権は彼の掌中に在り
He holds the destinies of his subordinates in his hands.
職員の任免黜陟は彼の掌中に在り
He has the control of the staff in his hands.

content:
ちっと〔些っと〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: ちと〔些と〕

content:
ちっとは〔些っとは〕
〈副〉A little; a bit (of...); something (of...):(疑問なら)anything (of...?)

content.content: 英語ですか? ちっとはできます
English? I know a little.
今度の先生はちっとは学問ができるか
Is the new man anything of a scholar?
ちっとはできそうだ
He seems to be something of a scholar―something of a one―a bit of a one.
ちっとは文章を書く
He is a bit of a writer.
ちっとは詩も作る
He is a bit of a poet.
なんでもかでもちっとはやる
He is a bit of everything.

content:
ちっとも〔些っとも〕
〈副〉［注意］英語を標準とす。
1. Not at all

content.content: あの先生はちっとも英語を知らない
He knows no English at all.
講義はちっとも面白くない
His lectures are not interesting at all.

content: 2. Not (in) the least

content.content: 僕はちっとも怖くない
I am not in the least afraid.
どんな物だかちっとも知らない
I have not the least idea of―have not the slightest notion of―have not the faintest conception of―what it is like.

content: 3. None whatever

content.content: ちっとも心配なことはない
There is no cause whatever for alarm.

content: 4. No (+名詞); nothing of (a or the...)

content.content: あの先生はちっとも学問ができない
He is no scholar―nothing of a scholar.
ちっとも学者肌が無い
He has nothing of the scholar in him.
この頃ちっとも会わない
I have seen nothing of him lately.
ここの意味がちっともわからない
I can make nothing of this passage.

content: 5. Not a bit of it

content.content: 怖いかって? ちっとも
Am I afraid? Not a bit of it.［注意］この形に倣うもの多し。
風がちっとも無い
There is not a breath of air.
雨はちっとも降らない
Not a drop of rain falls.
彼は酒はちっとも飲まない
He does not drink a drop of wine.
病人は今日は食がちっもと通らない
The invalid has not tasted a morsel of food today.
昨夜はちっとも眠れなかった
I did not get a wink of sleep last night.
彼は英語をちっとも知らない
He does not know a word of English.

content:
ちっぷく〔蟄伏〕
〈名〉Hibernation:(=する) to hibernate; to lie dormant; to lie concealed

content.content: 蛇は冬期蟄伏する
Snakes lie dormant in winter―hibernate.

content:
ちっぽけ
〈形〉Petty

content.content: 船はちっぽけな船だ
The ship is a petty affair―a one-horse concern. ［注意］この“affair”“concern”は“a petty one”“a one-horse one”と言うべき反復代名詞に代わる。

ちてん〔地点〕
〈名〉A point; a spot

content:
ちと〔些と〕
〈副〉A little; a trifle; a bit; somewhat; rather (than otherwise)

content.content: 病人はちとよい方だ
He is a little better.
船はちと旧式に属する
The ship is a trifle out of date.
意味がちと曖昧だ
The meaning is somewhat ambiguous.
成功はちとおぼつかない
Success is somewhat doubtful.
今日はちと温かい
It is rather warm today.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: ちと遊びに来給え
Come to see me sometimes!

ちどうせつ〔地動説〕
〈名〉The Copernican theory

content:
ちとく〔智徳〕
〈名〉Knowledge and virtue; wisdom and virtue:(=の) intellectual and moral

content.content: 智徳を磨く
to cultivate wisdom and virtue―attain intellectual and moral excellence―seek truth and do good
智徳は車の両輪の如し
Knowledge and virtue are (like) the two wheels of a cart.
少年には智徳を進めるような本を読ましむべし
You should place in the hands of boys such books as will make them better and wiser.

ちとせ〔千歳〕
〈名〉A thousand years; a millennium

content:
ちどめ〔血止め〕

〈名〉Setting the hand (to some work):(=する) to set one's hand to (an undertaking); to put one's hand to the plough; to proceed to business; to go to work; to fall to work; to set to work; to set about (one's task); to take (a matter) in hand; to start (some work):(=させる)to put (an order) in hand

content.content: 早速仕事に着手致します
I will set about my task at once―set to work at once―proceed to business without delay.
事業に着手したなら後ろを顧るな
He who sets his hand to an undertaking―puts his hand to the plough―must not look back.
(弁護士に向かって)事件に御着手を願います
I request you will take the matter in hand.
今新著述に着手している
I have a new work in hand―I am engaged on a new work.
御註文は早速着手致させ可申候{ごちゅうもんはさっそくちゃくしゅいたさせもうすべくそうろう}
Your order shall be put in hand without delay.
工事は未だ着手の運びに至らず
The works are not yet started.
船の建造に着手する
to lay down a ship
鉄道の敷設に着手する
to lay down a railway
第一着手として何をするのか
What shall I do in the first place?―in the first instance?

to dress properly

It is all ready―(出来合いの品物なら)―ready-made―(家なら)―ready-built―(食物なら)―ready-cooked―ready-boiled―ready-roasted―(荷造りなら)―ready-packed―(口上なら)―cut and dried.
チャンと合っている
It is all right―quite correct.
チャンとわかっている
I know all about it―It is quite clear.

content: 〈以下特例〉

It is irrevocably fixed―a settled affair―a done thing.

チャンと証文にして貰いたい
I want you promise in black and white.
彼のする事はチャンと順序が立っている
Everything he does, is systematic―methodical―business-like.

ちゅう〔中〕
〈名〉
1. (=極端に対し)the mean; the medium

to take the mean―take the golden mean between two extremes―take the middle course―hit the happy medium―steer between Scylla and Charybdis

2. (=本の中巻)the second (of three volumes)

content.content: 試験の成績は中だ
The result of his examination is middling.
あの人の英語はたいして好くも悪くもない、まあ中だ
His English is neither very good nor very bad, it is of indifferent quality.
あの人の才は中だ
He is a mediocre genius―a mediocrity.
背は中背だ
He is of medium height.
中肉中背
She is of medium flesh and height.
中等品
articles of medium quality
中型、中判
medium size
中幅
medium width
中年
middle age
中流
the middle class
中学校
the middle school

content:
〈前置詞相当〉
1. During

content.content: 戦争中
during the war
試験中
during the examination
暑中
during the summer
寒中
during the winter
病気中
during my illness
不在中
during my absence
滞在中
during my stay

content: 2. During; in

content.content: 病気中
during my illness (=while I was ill)―in my illness (=when I was ill) ［注意］“During”は「時」に重きを置き、“in”はその「状態」に重きを置く。
病気中、学校を休んだ
I absented myself from school during my illness―while I was ill.
病気中はお世話になりました
You were good to me in my illness―when I was ill.
不在中は弟が代理します
My brother will take my place during my absence―while I am absent.
不在中の出来事で詳しいことは知らぬ
I do not know the particulars, for it happened in my absence―when I was absent.

content: 3. During; on

content.content: 旅行中
while on a journey (“to go on a journey 旅行に行く”より出た表現)
彼は支那へ旅行中に知り合いになった
I made his acquaintance while on a journey in China.
親父は旅行中で不在です
My father is away on a journey.
夫は航海中で不在です
My husband is away on a voyage.
彼は渡航中に死んだ
He died on the passage―during the passage.

content: 4. In; during; through; throughout

content.content: 暑中
(一般の暑中は)―in summer―(この暑中は)―during the summer―(暑中通じては)―through the summer―all through the summer―throughout the summer
暑中は海水浴へ行く人が多い
Many people go to the seaside in summer.
暑中は旅行します
I shall go on a journey during the summer.
暑中は樺太へ行きました
I went to Saghalien during the summer.
僕は暑中はぶっ通して東京に居た
I stayed in Tokyo(all) through the summer―throughout the summer.
冬期中は温泉へ行く人が多い
Many people go to the hot springs in winter.
冬期中は熱海へ行った
I went to Atami during the winter.
冬期中熱海に居った
I stayed at Atami (all) through the winter―throughout the winter.
そこは年中花が咲いていた
Flowers bloom there through the year―throughout the year―all the year round.
夜中火事が続いた
The fire lasted through the night―throughout the night―all the night through―all night.

content: 5. During; pending

content.content: 試験中
(試験の続く間は)―during the examination―(試験のすまぬ間は、答案を出すまでは)―pending the examination
彼は試験中に病気になった
He fell ill during the examination.
試験中は生徒に参考書を許さぬ
The students are not allowed to consult any books pending the examination.
公判中は(判決になるまでは)被告に面会を許さぬ
The prisoner is not allowed to see visitors pending the trial.
交渉中は(話の決まるまでは)事業停止
The work is suspended pending the negotiation.

content: 6. In the course of (the day, the night, the week, the month, etc.)

content.content: 今日中に仕事をしてしまわなければならぬ
I must get the work finished in the course of the day―before the day is out.
今夜中に立退かねばならぬ
We must leave the place in the course of the night―before the night is out.
今週中に準備をしなければならぬ
The preparations must be made in the course of the week―before the week is out.
今月中に金を返さなければならぬ
The money must be paid in the course of the month―before the month is out―by the end of the month.
今年中に普請は落成しますか
Will the house be completed in the course of the year?―by the end of the year?

content: 7. In the course of; in course of

content.content: 詮議中(に)
in course of discussion―in the course of discussion
問題は今詮議中
The matter is in course of discussion.
詮議中に名論卓説が出た
Some original remarks were made in the course of discussion.
彼は談話中にうまいしゃれを言った
He made some witty remarks in the course of conversation.

content: 8. In course of; in process of; under

content.content: 家は建築中
The house is building―in course of construction―in process of construction―under construction.
古い家は目下修繕中
The old house is now under repairs.
病人は治療中
The invalid is under (medical) treatment.
機械は試験中
The machine is in course of examination―in process of examination―under examination.
問題は今詮議中
The matter is in course of discussion―in process of discussion―under discussion.

content: 9. In; on; at

content.content: 授業中の談話はいかん
No talking in class!
職員は授業中
The teachers are teaching―on duty.
一座は食事中
The company are at table―at dinner―at breakfast―at lunch―at supper.
ヨーロッパはそのころ戦争中であった
Europe was then at war.
本は印刷中
The book is printing―in the press.
事は進行中
The thing is going on―in progress.
(電話は)話し中
Engaged!
お話し中お邪魔ですが
Excuse me for interrupting you, but...

content: 10. All over; throughout

content.content: 英語は世界中に通ずる
English is spoken all over the world―all the world over.
彼の名は日本中に知れ渡っている
His name is known all over the country―throughout the land.

content: 11. Among; of

content.content: 英国は海軍中第一位を占む
England is the first among the naval powers―the first of all the naval powers.
彼は教員中で一番だ
He is the first of all the teachers.
教員中で一番の学者だ
She is the best scholar among the teachers.
英学者中の錚々たるものだ
He is prominent among English scholars.

content: 12. In; out of

content.content: 十中の一
one in ten
十中八九
nine out of ten
そんな人は十中に一人もない
There is not one such man in ten.
十中八九まではそう言う
Nine men out of ten will say so.
こういう人は十中の八九までは堕落する
In nine cases out of ten,―Ten to one,―such man will go to the bad.

content:
ちゅう〔宙〕
〈名〉Mid-air

content.content: 宙にぶら下がる
to be suspended in mid-air
彼は宙を飛んで来た
He came running at the top of his speed―like a flash of lightning.
提供などが宙に迷う(応じ手がない、受け手がない)
An offer goes a-begging.

content:
ちゅう〔忠〕
〈名〉Loyalty, fidelity, truth, duty (to one's master):(形容詞に用いれば)loyal, faithful, true (to one's master)

content.content: 忠を尽せ
Be loyal to your sovereign!―Be faithful to your master!―Be true to your country!
君には忠、親には孝なれ
Be faithful to your lord, and obedient to your father.
忠ならんと欲せば孝ならず、孝なからんと欲せば忠ならず
If I do my duty to my lord, I shall fail in my duty to my father; if I do my duty to my father, I shall fail in my duty to my lord.
職務に忠
to be faithful to one's duties
主義に忠
to be true to one's colours
大姦は忠に似たり
A foul heart is often found under a fair form―A fair form is often found to conceal a foul heart.

content:
ちゅう〔衷〕
〈名〉One's inmost heart

content.content: 衷をひらく
to reveal one's inmost thoughts to some one

content:
ちゅう〔註〕
〈名〉An annotation; a comment; a commentary; explanatory notes

content.content: 註を施す、註を加える
to annotate the text―comment upon the text―add explanatory notes to the text

content:
ちゆう〔智勇〕
〈名〉Wisdom and valour; courage and sagacity

content.content: 智勇兼備の良将だ
He is a general combining wisdom and valour.
彼は人に将たるに必要な智勇を欠いている
He is wanting in that wisdom and valour which are requisite to a commander.

ちゅうあいなる〔忠愛なる〕
〈形〉Loyal and loving (subjects, etc.)

〈名〉(陸軍中尉)a lieutenant:(海軍中尉)a junior lieutenant (ranking between the lieutenant and the sublieutenant)

content:
ちゅうい〔注意〕
〈名〉
1. (=注意して扱うの注意)care:(=する) take care of, be careful of (anything):(=して) carefully; with care

content.content: 身体に注意せよ(からだを大事にせよ)
Take good care of your health!―Be careful of your health!
機械を注意して扱え
Treat the instrument with care.
この一章を注意して読め
Read the chapter carefully―with care.
(こわれ物の貨物に記す)取扱注意
With care.
彼は注意周到だ
He is scrupulously careful―He does everything with scrupulous care―He leaves nothing to chance.

content: 2. (=注意して見る、注意して聴くの注意)attention; note:(=する) to give attention to (details); to pay attention to (one's teacher); to note, take note of (facts, etc.):(=して) with attention

content.content: 先生の言うことを注意して聴け
Pay attention to your teacher.
先生は細かいことに注意する
He gives attention to details.
注意して見る
to look at anything with attention―note facts―take note of facts
その人と知ったらもっと注意して見るのだったに
If I had known that it was he, I would have looked at him with more attention.
これは注意して見るべき事実だ
You should note the fact―The fact is worthy of note.
注意すべき事実だ
It is a noteworthy fact.
よく注意して見よ
Note well!
注意を一点に集中する
to concentrate one's attention upon a point―localize one's attention upon a point

content: 3. (=注意して事をするの注意)attention:(=する) to attend to, mind (one's business)

content.content: 己が勤めに注意して怠るな
Attend to your business!―Mind your business!―Mind what you are about!
足下御注意
Mind your footing!―Be circumspect!
言語挙動に注意せよ
Mind your P's and Q's.
専門を選ぶにあたって最も注意すべきことは
What are the points to be attended to in choosing one's profession?

content: 4. (=注意を引く、注意を促すの注意)attention; notice; interest

content.content: 世人の注意を引く
to attract notice―draw attention―arouse interest
この争論が世間の注意を引いている
The controversy is attracting public attention―arousing the interest of the public―watched with interest.
この事実にご注意を促す
I with to call your attention―invite your attention―solicit your attention―to this fact―I wish to bring the fact to your notice.
係りの者に注意しておきましょう
I will call the attention of the person in charge to the matter.
この問題は注意を要する
The question requires attention―demands attention.
この問題は一通りならぬ注意を要する
The question deserves more than a passing notice.

content: 5. (=用心)caution; carefulness:(=する) to take care, be careful, beware; to beware of, be cautious of, guard against (a habit―は習慣に陥らぬように用心する); to look out for (a danger―は危険を警戒する); to keep an eye on (a suspicious man―は人の挙動などを油断なく注目する)

content.content: ご注意あれ(ご用心)
Beware!―Take care!―Have a care!―Be careful!
もっと注意さえすりゃこんなことはないのだに
If you were more careful, such things would never happen.
風邪を引かぬように注意せよ
Be careful not to take cold!
言質を取られぬように注意せよ
Be careful not to commit yourself!―Beware of committing yourself!―Be cautious of committing yourself!
この悪習に陥らぬよう注意すべし

Be careful not to get into this bad habit―Beware of this habit!―Guard against this habit!―Be on your guard against this habit!―Be cautious of this habit―(他動詞構文にすれば)―I must caution you against the habit―warn you against this habit.
あの男は挙動があやしいから注意しろ
His movements are suspicious. Keep an eye on him!
踏切を通る時は汽車に注意しろ
When you pass a crossing, look out for the train!

content: 6. (=人に与える注意)reminder; warning:(=する) to remind (a person of his fault); to warn (one of danger)

content.content: なにとぞ行き届きませぬところはご注意を願います
You will please remind me of my faults―put me in mind for my failings.
彼に勤めを怠らぬように注意しておやりなさい
You must remind him of his duty.
彼の身に大難の振りかかっていることを幾度も注意した
I warned him several times that a great danger hung over his head―warned him of an impending danger.
彼の非を挙げるのは、ただご注意のため
I mention his faults only to warn you.
(後から苦情の出ないように)あらかじめ注意しておく
I give you fair warning―give you due warning.
これに懲りて将来注意なさい(これをもって後来の戒めとせよ)
Let this be a warning to you for the future!
彼は医者の注意を聴かずに相変わらず飲んでいる
He keeps on drinking in spite of his doctor's warning.

content: 7. (=する)(=吟味する)to be careful, particular (about something)

content.content: 親父は着物にはかまわないが食物には非常に注意する
My father is careless about dress, but very particular about food.

content: 8. (=参考にする注意)a hint; a suggestion

content.content: 授業などの参考になる注意を与えよう
I will give you hints―give you points―make some suggestions―on the teaching.

content: 9. (=何に注意して)with a view to (something)

content.content: この家は空気の流通に注意して建ててある
This house is built with a view to ventilation.
食物は衛生に注意して選ぶべし
Food should be chosen with a view to health.
