content:
ちゅうこく〔忠告〕
〈名〉Advice; counsel; recommendation; warning; admonition; remonstrance:(=する) to give (one) advice; to advise, counsel (one to do something); to counsel (flight); to recommend (travelling); to warn (one that there is danger―one of danger); to admonish (one what one ought to do―one of one's duty); to remonstrate (with one on one's mistake)

content.content: 君の忠告に従おう
I will follow your advice―act upon your advice.
君の忠告に従って酒を止めた
Upon your advice, I have given up drinking.
彼は僕の忠告を容れた

彼は僕の忠告を聴かずに相変わらず飲んでいる

人の忠告を聴かないからそんな目にあうのだ

為すべきことを怠らぬように忠告してやった

〈名〉
1. An order (for goods):(=する) to order (an article from a firm―an article from abroad); to give an order (for an article to a firm); to place an order (for an article with a firm)

content.content: 品物を註文する

An order (for a warship) has been placed with an English firm.
品物は註文してある
The article is on order.
品物は註文してこしらえた
The article was made to order.

an article made to order―(未製品なら)―goods on order
(手紙で)本を註文する
to write for a book
御註文の書籍持ち合わせ御座無く候
We do not happen to have on hand the book you write for.
その本を(一部)英国へ註文しよう
I will write to England for a copy.
御註文の程奉願上候{ごちゅうもんのほどねがいあげたてまつりそうろう}
We beg you will favour us with your orders―We solicit your orders.
註文をとる
to solicit orders―canvass for orders―book orders
註文を調達する
to execute an order―fill an order
御註文は丁寧迅速に調達可仕候
All orders carefully and promptly executed.
御註文は入念に調達可仕候
Your orders shall receive our best attention.

Your order shall be put in hand without delay.
註文に応ずる

大きな註文を引受けて他のご註文はお断りしております

大口の註文、小口の註文

content:
ちょうだい〔頂戴〕
〈命令法〉Please give me (something); make me a present of (something):(より)please, kindly, be so kind as to, be good enough to, have the goodness to (do something for me)

content.content: お名刺を頂戴
Give me your card!
お写真を一枚頂戴
Will you make me a present of your photo?
お盃頂戴
Pass me the cup!―(西洋では)―Pass me the bottle!
本を貸して頂戴
Please lend me the book!―Be so kind as to lend me the book!
ここをあけて頂戴
Please open the door for me!

content:
ちょうだいする〔頂戴する〕
〈他動〉(The honorific term for) to receive, accept, take, eat, drink

content.content: (酒はたくさんだから)お茶を頂戴します
I'll take tea (if you don't mind).
お茶を頂戴したいものだ
I should like some tea.
このお写真を頂戴してもよろしいんですか
May I have this photo?―May I keep it?
(下さる物なら)ありがたく頂戴します
I shall receive it with thanks―accept it with gratitude.
(ご馳走が出たから)さあ頂戴しよう
Let's fall to!
たくさんに頂戴しました
I am doing very well―I have made a good dinner.
たいそうおいしく頂戴しました
I have enjoyed my dinner.
十分に(十二分に)頂戴しました
I have done ample justice to the repast.
十分に頂戴すれば二の膳も同然
“Enough is as good as a feast.”
頂戴したも同じことです(お志でたくさん)
I will take the will for the deed.

content:
ちょうたいそく〔長大息〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ちょうだいそく〔長大息〕

ちょうだいそく〔長大息〕
〈名〉A long breath; a deep sigh:(=する) to draw a long breath; to heave a deep sigh

content:
ちょうだいもの〔頂戴物〕
〈名〉A gift, a present (from a superior)

content.content: 主人から頂戴物をする
to receive a gift from one's master

ちょうだしゅつ〔腸脱出〕
〈名〉Prolapsus of the rectum

content:
ちょうだつする〔調達する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=註文を調達する)to execute, fill (an order)

content.content: 御註文は迅速に調達仕候{ごちゅうもんはじんそくにちょうだつつかまつりそうろう}
All orders promptly executed.

content: 2. (=物品を調達する)to supply (articles); to supply, serve (a family with commodities); to purvey (articles of food)

content.content: 註文の品を調達する
to supply (one with) the article ordered
お屋敷へ日用品を調達致します
We supply the family―serve the family―(with commodities, grocery, fish, vegetables, etc.)

content: 3. (=金子を調達する)to raise, make out, make up, have ready (a sum of money)

content.content: 大金を調達しなければならぬ
I must raise a large sum of money.
大金のことですから早速には調達しかねます
I can not have such a large sum ready at a moment's notice.
何を抵当にして金を調達する
to raise money on something
所有地を抵当にして調達した金だ
The money was raised on my estate.

content:
ちょうだつする〔超脱する〕
〈他動〉To rise above, be raised above, be exalted above, stand aloof from (the world, etc.)

content.content: 世俗を超脱する
to rise above the world―stand aloof from the crowd
彼は世俗を超脱して名利に淡い
He is above the world and indifferent to wealth or fame.
はるかに凡俗を超脱している
He is exalted above the vulgar crowd.
生死を超脱する
to rise above life and death

content:
ちょうたん〔長短〕
〈名〉
1. (=長い短い)relative length

content.content: 両者は長短を異にす
They are different in length―of different lengths.

content: 2. (=長所と短所)(one's) merits and faults, merits and defects, merits and demerits

content.content: 人皆長短あり
Everybody has his merits and faults―his merits and defects―his merits and demerits.
二人は長短を同じうす
They have the same merits and faults.
長短を異にす
They have different merits and faults.
長短相補う、長短相半ばす
He has enough merits to set off against his faults―His merits and faults offset each other―His merits offset his faults.

content:
ちょうち〔懲治〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ちょうじ〔懲治〕

content:
ちょうちふす〔腸窒扶斯<腸チフス>〕
〈名〉Typhoid fever; enteric fever

content.content: 腸チフスが流行する
Typhoid fever prevails.
腸チフスに罹った
I was attacked with typhoid fever.
彼は今腸チフスに罹っている
He is suffering from typhoid fever.
近頃腸チフスに罹る者がたくさんある
There have been many cases of typhoid fever.
腸チフスで死ぬ者がある
Some people die of typhoid fever―Some cases of typhoid fever prove fatal.

content:
ちょうちふす〔腸窒扶斯<腸チフス>〕
〈名〉Typhoid fever; enteric fever

content.content: 腸チフスが流行する
Typhoid fever prevails.
腸チフスに罹った
I was attacked with typhoid fever.
彼は今腸チフスに罹っている
He is suffering from typhoid fever.
近頃腸チフスに罹る者がたくさんある
There have been many cases of typhoid fever.
腸チフスで死ぬ者がある
Some people die of typhoid fever―Some cases of typhoid fever prove fatal.

ちょうちゃくする〔打擲する〕
〈他動〉To beat, belabour (a man)
ちょうちゅうせっぽう

ちょうちゅうせっぽう〔帳中説法〕
〈名〉(A wife's) curtain-lecture

content:
ちょうちょう〔喋々〕
〈副〉(To talk) glibly, volubly:(=する) to talk glibly; to talk, make words, make many words (about anything)

content.content: 明治の初年に洋行帰りの彼は自由民権を喋々したものだ
He had just returned from abroad in the early years of Meiji, and used to talk glibly about liberty and popular rights.
いまさら喋々するを要せず
There is no need of making words about it now.
喋々喃々する(ベラベラしゃべる)
to talk glibly―talk volubly―babble―gabble―be loquacious―be talkative―be garrulous

ちょうちょう〔町長〕
〈名〉The headman of a town; a town headman

content:
ちょうちょう〔蝶々〕
〈名〉A butterfly

content.content: 蝶々がヒラヒラ飛ぶ
A butterfly flutters about.
蝶々が花に戯れる
A butterfly flutters from flower to flower.
蝶々が花に止まる
A butterfly alights on a flower.

content:
ちょうちょうはっし〔丁々発止〕
〈擬音詞〉Clang; clash

content.content: 丁々発止の物音
the clash of arms―the clang of arms
丁々発止と切り結ぶ
to cross swords with a clang―clash swords together

content:
ちょうちん〔提灯〕
〈名〉A paper-lantern

content.content: 提灯を貼る
to make paper-lanterns (as a vocation)
提灯を点ける
to light a lantern
提灯を消す
to put out the lantern
お祭りで提灯を下げる
The houses are decorated with lanterns in honour of the festival.
提灯をお持ちなさい、外は暗いから
Take a lantern with you, it is dark without.
鼻から提灯を出す
to bubble at the nose
提灯に釣鐘だ
It is an unequal match―a lop-sided match.

ちょうちんぎょうれつ

content:
ちょうちんぎょうれつ〔提灯行列〕
〈名〉A lantern procession; a lantern parade

content.content: 提灯行列をして市中を練りまわした
We made a lantern procession, and paraded the streets.

content:
ちょうちんもち〔提灯持ち〕
〈名〉A lantern-carrier:(人のために吹聴する者は)a candle-holder

content.content: 人のお提灯持ちをする
to hold a candle to the devil―(米国では)―boost
あんな奴のお提灯持ちをするな
Do not hold a candle to such a fellow!

content:
ちょうつがい〔蝶番〕
〈名〉A hinge

content.content: 西洋戸には蝶番がある
A door hangs on its hinges.
蝶番がはずれた
The door is off its hinges.

ちょうつけ〔丁付け〕
〈名〉Pagination:(=する) to paginate (a book); to number the pages of (a book)

content:
ちょうつけ〔帳付け〕
〈名〉(事)book-keeping; keeping accounts:(人)a book-keeper; an accountant

content.content: 帳づけをする
to keep books―keep accounts

content:
ちょうづけ〔丁づけ〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ちょうつけ〔丁付け〕

content:
ちょうづけ〔帳付け〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ちょうつけ〔帳付け〕

ちょうづめ〔腸詰め〕
〈名〉A sausage

ちょうてい〔朝廷〕
〈名〉The Imperial court; the Imperial government

content:
ちょうてい〔調停〕
〈名〉
1. (=仲裁)intervention; mediation; peace-making:(=する) to intervene between, mediate between, go between, make peace between (two parties)

content.content: 二人の間に入って調停する
to intervene between―mediate between―go between―make peace between―two parties
僕が調停の労をとろう
I will mediate between the two parties―act as mediator.

content: 2. (=仲直りさせること)reconciliation (between estranged friends); settlement (of a dispute); accommodation (of differences):(=する) to reconcile (estranged friends); to settle (a dispute); to accommodate (differences); to accord (a difference); to make up (a quarrel)

content.content: 争いを調停する
to settle a dispute―accommodate differences―accord differences―reconcile differences―make up a quarrel―heal the breach―heal a feud―mediate a quarrel―mediate a peace―make peace

content:
ちょうてき〔朝敵〕
〈名〉A rebel (to the Imperial cause)

content.content: 朝敵を征伐する
to subjugate a rebel―punish a rebel

content:
ちょうてん〔頂点〕
〈名〉
1. (=いただき)the summit (of a mountain); the top (of a hill); the apex (of a pyramid); the vertex (of a figure, etc.)
2. (=絶頂)the summit, the zenith, the height (of prosperity); the acme (of perfection); the culmination (of power); the climax (of one's career, etc.)

content.content: そのころ英国は繁栄の頂点に達していた
England was then at the summit of her prosperity―at the zenith of her prosperity.

content:
ちょうでん〔弔電〕
〈名〉A telegram of condolence; a condolatory telegram

content.content: 弔電を発する
to despatch a condolatory telegram

content:
ちょうと〔長途〕
〈名〉A long journey

content.content: 長途のお疲れでさぞご難儀でしょう
You must feel the fatigues of your long journey.

content:
ちょうど〔丁度〕
〈副〉
1. (=きちんと)just; exactly; precisely

content.content: ちょうど同じ
They are just the same―exactly the same―precisely the same.
それでちょうど好い
That's just right.
彼の顔はちょうど猿のようだ
His face is just like a monkey's―for all the world, like a monkey's.
彼はいつも(遅からず早からず)ちょうど好い時に来る
He always appears just at the right moment―in the nick of time.
君はちょうど好い時に来た、幕が今あいたばかりだ
You have come just in time―You are just in time for the commencement of the play.
(遅くなく)ちょうど好い時に家を飛び出した、飛び出すや否や家が倒れた
I ran out of the house none too soon, for it fell with a crash the moment I was out.
ちょうど三年になる
It is exactly three years―three years to a day.
ちょうど一カ月になる
It is exactly a month―one month to an hour.
ちょうど二時間だ
It is exactly two hours―two hours to a minute.
ちょうど一マイルある
The distance is exactly a mile―one mile to an inch.
上衣は君にちょうど好く合う
The coat fits you exactly―fits you to a nicety―fits you to a T―fits you like a glove―fits you like wall-paper.
(帯に短し襷に長しで)ちょうど好いのが無い
There is no suitable one―None of them suit me.

content: 2. (=真向に)directly; right; plumb; dead

content.content: ちょうど真中に当たる
It falls right in the centre―plumb in the centre.
ちょうど同じ方向を指す
It points right in the same direction―plumb in the same direction.
その家はちょうど向こう(真向こう)だ
The house is right opposite ours.
ちょうど船の針路に当たって暗礁がある
There are breakers right ahead―dead ahead―directly in our course.

content: 3. (=方向のちょうど)due

content.content: そこはちょうど西(真西)にあたる
The place lies due west of this.
(航海中)陸はちょうど南(真南)に当たる
Land bears due south.

content: 4. (=時間のちょうど)punctually; sharp

content.content: ちょうど八時(正八時に始まる)
It begins punctually at eight―at eight sharp―at eight to the minute.

content:
〈代用形容詞〉
5. (=貸借無しのちょうど)even; square

content.content: これでちょうど(貸借無し、帳消し)になる
This will make the accounts even―make all even―make all square.

content: 6. (=半端の無いちょうど)round

content.content: ちょうど一ダース
a round dozen
(端数を捨てて)ちょうどにしておけ
Make it a round sum.
ちょうど百円にしておこう
I will make it a round hundred.

content: 7. (=ちょうど好い)the right, the very, just the (person or thing)

content.content: 君はちょうど好い人を捜しあてた
You have pitched upon the right man.
ちょうど好い人だ(適材適所)
He is the right man in the right place.
あの人ならちょうどお誂い向きだ
He is the very man―just the man―for me.
それならちょうどお誂い向きだ(鬼に金棒)
That's the very thing―just the thing―the thing―the ticket―the card.
二人はちょうど似合った夫婦だ
He is the very husband for her, and she is just the wife for him―They are made for each other.

content:
8. 
〈代用動詞〉(=に) to happen, chance (to do something)

content.content: その時ちょうどに兄が居合わした
Then my brother happened to be by.
僕はちょうどに人を捜していた
I happened to be looking out for a man.
するとちょうどに口を捜している人があった
And there chanced to be a man who was looking out for a job.
ちょうどに大島行きの便船があったからこれに便乗した
I took passage in a steamer which happened to be bound for Oshima.

content:
ちょうど〔調度〕
〈名〉Utensils; things; supplies

content.content: 御調度万端御質素の聖旨畏し
It is the Imperial command that simplicity should be observed in everything.

ちょうどうとく〔超道徳〕
〈名〉Antinomianism:(=の) antinomian

ちょうどきゅうかん〔超弩級艦〕
〈名〉A superdreadnought

ちょうどきょく〔調度局〕
〈名〉The Bureau of Supplies

content:
ちょうない〔町内〕
〈名〉A street community (of the old Edo regime); (hence) the neighbourhood

content.content: 町内の若い者
the young men of the street (who used to band themselves into a fire-company)
町内安全
May nothing go amiss in the neighbourhood!
町内事無かれ
Anything for a quiet life!
町内の幅利き、町内の顔役
a man of influence in the neighbourhood
町内の口利き
the spokesman of the neighbourhood
町内で知らぬは亭主ばかりなり
“The good man is the only one who does not know what is amiss at home.”

ちょうなん〔長男〕
〈名〉One's eldest son

ちょうにく〔鳥肉〕
〈名〉Fowl; chicken

content:
ちょうにん〔町人〕
〈名〉A townsman; a tradesman; a merchant:(賤しんで言えば)a pleb

content.content: 素町人だ
He is a mere pleb.
町人風情
He is only a pleb.
町人根性
a sordid spirit

ちょうば〔丁場〕
〈名〉
1. A stage (in travelling)
2. (=俥の丁場)a jinrikisha-station

content:
ちょうば〔帳場〕
〈名〉The counter

content.content: 帳場に坐る
to sit behind the counter
帳場で勘定を払う
to pay one's bill over the counter―across the counter

ちょうば〔調馬〕
〈名〉Training horses; breaking horses:(=する) to train horses; to break in horses

ちょうば〔嘲罵〕
〈名〉Derisive abuse; derision; ridicule:(=する) to deride, ridicule, rail at, rail against (a man or his conduct)

ちょうばし〔調馬師〕
〈名〉A horse-breaker; a horse-trainer; a rough-rider

content:
ちょうはつ〔徴発〕
〈名〉Requisition; commandeering; annexation; impressment; forage:(=する) to requisition, commandeer, annex (goods); to put (goods) in requisition; to place (goods) under requisition; to press (men) into the service; to impress (goods) for public service; to forage (corn from the enemy)

content.content: 徴発される
to be requisitioned―be commandeered―be annexed―be put in requisition―be placed under requisition―be laid under contribution

content:
ちょうはつ〔挑発〕
〈名〉Provocation; suggestion; excitement; incitement; stimulation:(=する) to provoke, be provocative of (some desire); to suggest, be suggestive of (indecent or improper thoughts); to excite, inflame (the passions); to stimulate (sexual appetite); to whet (one's appetite); to pique (one's vanity); to incite (people to sedition)

content.content: 劣情を挑発する
to excite the low passions―to be suggestive
色情を挑発する
to excite sexual desire―stimulate sexual desire
挑発的
suggestive (picture or play)―provocative (speech or behaviour)―incendiary (speech)―seditious (oration)―inflammatory (writings, etc.)

ちょうばつ〔懲罰〕
〈名〉Punishment; chastisement; castigation; correction; discipline:(=する) to punish, chastise, castigate, correct, discipline (an offender)

ちょうはつたい〔徴発隊〕
〈名〉A foraging party

ちょうはつれい〔徴発令〕
〈名〉A requisition order

ちょうはながた〔蝶花形〕
〈名〉A paper butterfly

content:
ちょうはん〔丁半〕
〈名〉
1. Odd or even
2. (=ばくち)gambling

content.content: 丁半を争う
to gamble

content:
ちょうぶ〔町歩〕
〈名〉A land measure (=10 tan =nearly 2 1/2 acres)

content.content: 公園は面積四町歩ばかりある
The park covers an area of about 10 acres.

content:
ちょうふく〔重複〕
〈名〉
1. (=繰返し)repetition; reduplication:(=する) to repeat, reduplicate (the same thing)
2. (=正副二通作ること)duplication:(=する) to duplicate (documents)
3. (=言葉の重複)redundancy; tautology:(=せる) redundant; tautological

content.content: 重複語
a redundant expression―a tautological expression

content:
ちょうぶつ〔長物〕
〈名〉A useless thing

content.content: どんな好い武器が有っても使い方を知らなけりゃ無用の長物だ
The best weapons are useless if you do not know how to use them.

ちょうぶん〔弔文〕
〈名〉A memorial address (to the deceased)

ちょうふんせき〔鳥糞石〕
〈名〉Guano

content:
ちょうへい〔徴兵〕
〈名〉(事)conscription; compulsory military service:(人)a conscript

content.content: 徴兵に出る
to serve (one's time) in the army
徴兵に取られる
to be taken up for military service
あの人は徴兵に行って来たのだ
He has served in the army―served his time.
徴兵上がりだ
He is a returned conscript.
徴兵を免れる
to be exempted from military service―miss serving in the army―miss being a soldier
どうして徴兵を免れたか
How did you get exempted from military service?
抽籤で徴兵を免れた
I got exempted from military service by drawing a blank―I was exempted by lot.
あの人は身体が不合格で徴兵を免れた
He was rejected from military service owing to physical disqualification―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Physical disqualification exempted him from military service.
徴兵を忌避する
to evade military service
徴兵は国民の義務
It is the duty of a citizen ［one of the duties of citizenship］ to serve in the army.

content:
ちょうへいきひ〔徴兵忌避〕
〈名〉Evasion of military service

content.content: あの男は徴兵忌避だ
He has evaded military service.
徴兵忌避の廉をもって懲役三年に処せられた
He was sentenced to three years' penal servitude on the ground of the evasion of military service.

content:
ちょうへいけんさ〔徴兵検査〕
〈名〉The physical examination for conscription

content.content: 徴兵検査を受ける
to be examined for conscription
君は徴兵検査がすんだか
Have you been examined for conscription?
僕は徴兵検査前です
I am not yet examined for conscription.
彼は徴兵検査を受けて甲種に合格した
He was examined for conscription, and passed as Class A.

content:
ちょうへいせいど〔徴兵制度〕
〈名〉The conscription system

content.content: 新徴兵制度はいつから実施になったか
When did the new conscription system go into operation?―How long has the new conscription system been in operation?
英国ですら刻下の必要に応じて徴兵制度を採用した
Even England has adopted the conscription system in order to meet an emergency.

content:
ちょうへいてきれい〔徴兵適齢〕
〈名〉The conscription age; the military age

content.content: 僕は来年徴兵適齢だ
I shall be of conscription age―liable for military service―next year.

content:
ちょうへいねんれい〔徴兵年齢〕
〈名〉The conscription age; the military age

content.content: 僕は来年は徴兵年齢に当たる
I shall be of conscription age―liable for military service―next year.

content:
ちょうへいめんじょ〔徴兵免除〕
〈名〉Exemption from military service; rejection from military service

content.content: 君はどうして徴兵免除になったか
How did you get exempted from military service?―miss serving in the army?―miss being a soldier?
抽籤で徴兵免除になった
I was exempted by lot―I got exempted from military service by drawing a blank.
彼は身体不合格のために徴兵免除になった
He was rejected from military service owing to physical disqualification―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Physical disqualification exempted him from military service.

content:
ちょうへいゆうよ〔徴兵猶予〕
〈名〉Temporary exemption from military service; conscription privileges

content.content: 本校は徴兵猶予の特典あり
The school enjoys conscription privileges.
御校に徴兵猶予がありますか
Has your school conscription privileges?
徴兵猶予になる
to be temporarily exempted from military service
大学に入れば徴兵猶予になる

A light glimmers in the distance.
羽虫がチラチラ飛ぶ
Gnats flit about―flitter about.
蝶がチラチラ飛びまわる

(花が蝶々か蝶々が花か)来てはチラチラ迷わせる
She comes fluttering to steal away my heart.
花が風にチラチラ散る

雪がチラチラ降り出す
Snowflakes begin to flit in the air―flitter in the air.
蜘蛛の巣に日が当たるとチラチラする
Cobwebs glance in the sun.
黒板に日が当たるとチラチラする
The blackboard glaces in the sun―The sunlight glances on the blackboard.
月光が湖水にチラチラする
The moonlight plays on the lake.
湖水が木の間からチラチラ見える
The lake shows fitfully through the trees.
酔うと目がチラチラする
When you are drank, things swim before your eyes.

A motor-car raises a dust―kicks up a dust.

It is dusty.

The wind raises a dust―The roads are dusty when there is a wind.
雨が降ると塵が立たぬ
The rain lays the dust.
塵がたかる
to become covered with dust
着物に塵がたかった
My clothes are covered with dust.
機械に塵をたけるな
Keep the machine free from dust―It must be kept free from dust.
塵が積る
Dust accumulates.
塵が積っている
Dust lies thick (on the floor).
塵積って山となる
Dust amassed will make a mountain―“Many a pickle makes a mickle.”
塵を掃う
to brush away the dust
着物の塵を振り払う
to shake off the dust―shake the dust off one's clothes
塵を吹き払う
to blow the dust away
爪で上着の塵を払う
to fillip the dust off one's coat
刷毛で洋服の塵を払う
to brush a coat
はたきで座敷や道具の塵を払う
to dust the room and furniture
雨が降って空中の塵を払う
The rain clears the air from dust.
空中に塵が無い
The air is clear from dust.
船中に塵一つ無い
There is not a particle of dust―not a speck of dust―in the whole ship.
あの人は慾というものは塵ほども無い
There is not a particle of avarice in his nature.
(再び足踏みをせぬ決心で)足の塵を払って去る
to shake the dust off one's feet
お髭の塵を払う
to pay court to―curry favour with―dance attendance upon―lackey―toady―a great personage
塵を除ける
to keep the dust out
眼鏡をかけて塵を除ける
One wears goggles to keep the dust from one's eyes.

worldly affairs
浮世の塵を避ける
to seclude oneself from the world―hold aloof from the crowd―live remote from towns
塵の世
the dusty world―“the madding crowd.”
塵の世を離れて清き生涯を送る
Remote from towns,―Aloof from the crowd,―“Far from the madding crowd's ignoble strife,”―he runs his godly race.

散り散りばらばらになる

content:
ちりぢりばらばらになる〔散り散りばらばらになる〕
〈自動〉To disperse; to scatter; to be scattered asunder; to be torn asunder:(行列なら)to straggle

content.content: 一家が散り散りばらばらになる
A family breaks up―A home is torn up.
行列が散り散りばらばらになる
A procession straggles.

content:
ちりょう〔治療〕
〈名〉Cure; medical treatment:(=する) to treat (a patient); to cure (a disease―a person of a disease)

content.content: 治療を施す
to treat a patient―subject one to treatment
肺病の治療をする
to treat one for consumption―cure one of consumption
治療を受ける
to be treated―receive one's treatment―undergo medical treatment―be subjected to treatment―submit to treatment
病人は治療中
The invalid is under (medical) treatment.
治療を受けている
The invalid is under (medical) treatment.
佐藤博士の治療を受けている
He is under the treatment of Dr. Sato.
佐藤博士の治療で治った
He recovered under the treatment of Dr. Sato.
この病いは早速治療をしないと手後れになる
The disease calls for prompt treatment.
患者は治療の見込無し
The patient is past cure―past help of man―It is all over with him―It is all up with him―He is a gone case.
予防は治療に勝る
“Prevention is better than cure”―“An ounce of prevention is better than a pound of cure.”
治療に感応する
to respond to treatment
信仰治療
faith cure―Christian science
心理治療
psychical cure

ちりょうがく〔治療学〕
〈名〉Therapeutics

content.content: 治療法を変えてみよう
I will change the treatment.

〈擬音詞〉Tinkle-tinkle:(電鈴なら)r-r-r-r-rn

to tinkle―clink

content:
ちる〔散る〕
〈自動〉
1. To disperse; to scatter; to be scattered

content.content: 人が散る
People disperse.
花が散る
The flowers fall―The blossoms pass away.
今頃は桜が散ったろう
The cherry-blossoms must be gone―be over―by this.
風で花が散る
The gale scatters the blossoms―The flower-petals flit in the wind―flutter in the wind.
咲いた桜に
Why tie thy steed
何故駒繋ぐ
To a blossoming cherry-tree?
駒が勇めば
The horse will prance,
花が散る
The flowers scattered be.
時に逢わば散るも
Scatter to the mountain gale,
目出度し山桜
When please the powers above!
愛づるは花の
For not alone in blossom full
盛りのみかは
Do I thee, Cherry, love.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 火花が散る
Sparks fly.
墨が散る
Ink blots―blurs―runs―spreads―smudges.
秋は木の葉が散る
Trees shed their leaves in autumn.
腫物が散る
A tumour resolves.
気が散る
One's attention is distracted.
騒がしいと気が散る
Noise distracts the attention.
